172032.description:
You are mighty VIKINGS! Mighty, but very small. As you sail your ship around a bottlecap, you will loot and plunder gold and wood to improve your city (granting you new abilities) and gain victory points. And while you may get hurt along the way, sometimes it's best to just push ahead, because the Valkyries don't come to claim the dead immediately...

Bottlecap Vikings is a small rondel game with a ton of replayability. The rondel spaces are not fixed in place- they are randomized at the beginning of the game. Not only that, they're double-sided, so you might never play on the exact same configuration twice. There are two different victory conditions, and players each have a small "tech-tree" in their city with multiple viable paths. Furthermore, the city cards are double-sided, one side is identical for all players, and the other side is unique. To top it off, the crux of the gameplay is the push-your-luck damage system, which makes you value spaces differently depending on how damaged you or others already are.

Bottlecap Vikings is packaged with 3 mini-expansions for other Tasty Minstrel Games
Harbour: Ice Viking
Gold West: Bandits Promo
Eminent Domain: Battlecruisers – Heavy Assault
172032.name: Bottlecap Vikings
boardgamepodcastepisode: Strange Assembly 185 - Vikings

172033.description:
Players in Crab Stack represent a family of crabs who don't start out stacked, but who will become stacked over the course of the game, preferably being top crab in the end.

Each player has nine crabs — three large, three medium and three small — and they start in random locations on the game board at the start of play. On a turn, you move exactly one of your crabs — with a large crab moving exactly one space, a medium crab exactly two, and a small crab exactly three — so that you land on top of another crab of the same size or smaller, pinning it and preventing it from moving as long as you sit there.

You can't move over open water, and if your move splits the cast of crabs, then the smaller group is washed away by the waves.

If you can't move on your turn, then you're out of the game — even if one of your crabs is left uncovered later. The last player who makes a move wins!
172033.name: Crab Stack

172035.name: Thumbs Up!
172035.description:
Thumbs Up! is what you'll say if you're faster than the other players and can arrange your rings first.

To start play, each player take eight rings — two each of red, blue, green and yellow — and places them on the table. Each round states with one player revealing a challenge card that shows a colored image, with numbers on the various colored items. Players then race to stack some of their rings on one thumb in the order shown on the challenge card. The first player to do so claims the card, and the first player to collect five cards wins!

Thumbs Up! includes variants that have you start each round with the rings on your fingers or in a pile in the center of the table.

172037.name: Super Dogfight
172037.description:
User summary:

An action game exclusively for 2 players. Each player controls a propeller plane from a bird's view, both planes constantly moving forward with constant speed. Holding the joystick left or right makes the plane rotate in that direction; though it can only travel in 8 directions. Pushing the button fires a bullet.

The goal of the game is to hit the opponent's plane as many times as possible.

Individual credits:
R W Stevens: Program, design

172038.name: Doctor Who: Legacy
172038.description:
Fun, casual gem matching puzzle PRG game for BBC Doctor Who fans and all gamers!

Source: The Publisher Website.

172039.name: Snokie
172039.description:
Usery summary:

A patter-memorizing action running game. The plaeyr controls a penguin-esque character that must run continously to the right. In its way are holes in the ground, stones that come rolling from behind, moving floors and other obstacles. A hole in the ground or a stone will kill on touch.

The game is timed, but when reaching a checkpoint, the timer is reset, and upon death, the player will begin from the checkpoint.

Individual credits:
A Marsily: Concept
Troy London: Program
Yves Lempereur: program

172040.name: Endless Alphabet
172040.description:
Set the stage for reading success with this delightfully interactive educational app. Kids will have a blast learning their ABC's and building vocabulary with the adorable monsters in Endless Alphabet. Each word features an interactive puzzle with talking letters and a short animation illustrating the definition. Before you know it, your child will be using words like gargantuan and cooperate!

Features:
- Over 50 words to explore and learn. Please note that this app comes free with 7 word puzzles and animations. A one-time in-app purchase will unlock the rest.
- Delightful animations teach children the definitions of the words in a fun and engaging way.
- Word game teaches children letters.
- Endless Alphabet was designed with your children in mind. There are no high scores, failures, limits or stress. Your child can interact with the app at their own pace.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172041.name: Endless Reader
172041.description:
As a follow-up to Endless Alphabet, set the stage for early reading success with Endless Reader! This app introduces "sight words", the most commonly used words in school, library, and children's books. Kids need to recognize these words by sight in order to achieve reading fluency. Recognizing sight words is advantageous for beginning readers because many of these words have unusual spelling, cannot be sounded out using phonics knowledge, and often cannot be represented using pictures.
Kids will have a blast learning sight words and their context and usage with the adorable Endless monsters. Each word features an interactive word puzzle with letters that come alive, and then a sentence puzzle with words that become what they describe. See the word "dog" as a barking dog, and the word "up" reach for the sky!

NOTE: You must be online and have sufficient disk space while running the app to get all words you purchase in the app. **





Features:
- 6 words free to try with additional word packs available for purchase.
- Delightful animations reinforce sight recognition of words in a fun and interactive way.
- Word puzzles reinforce spelling using lower-case letters and the sentence puzzles teach definition and usage (in addition to sight recognition).
- Endless Reader was designed with your children in mind. There are no high scores, failures, limits or stress. Your children can interact with the app at their own pace.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172042.name: Endless Wordplay
172042.description:
As the next delightful app in the Endless series, Endless Wordplay sets the stage for spelling, word building, and wonderful rhymes! This app introduces key spelling patterns and phonograms that are important for beginning spellers and early writers. Written English can be complex and confusing, and Endless Wordplay reinforces spelling rules and variations using rhymes and a fun, progressive learning path.

Kids will have a blast learning spelling patterns and phonograms with the all-new Alphabot and the beloved Endless monsters. Each lesson reinforces a spelling and phonetic pattern using a sequence of rhyming word puzzles with letters that come alive. The rhyming words then lead to entertaining and illustrative animations that are as fun as they are educational.

Features:
- 3 spelling lessons (9 words) free to try with additional lessons available for purchase.
- The delightful lessons presented by Alphabot reinforce spelling and phonetic patterns in a fun and interactive way.
- Animations bring the rhyming words to life and reinforce definitions and usage.
- Endless Wordplay was designed with your children in mind. There are no high scores, failures, limits or stress. Your children can interact with the app at their own pace.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172043.name: Endless Numbers
172043.description:
As a follow-up to Endless Alphabet, set the stage for early numeracy learning with Endless Numbers! Kids will have a blast learning number recognition, sequences, quantity, numerical patterns, and simple addition with the adorable Endless monsters. Each number features interactive sequences and equation puzzles with numbers that come alive, and a short animation that provides context and meaning to each number.

Features:
- 5 numbers are free to try with numbers in Number Packs available for purchase.
- Delightful animations reinforce number recognition, quantity, and counting.
- Interactive number puzzles reinforce basic numeracy skills.
- Endless Numbers was designed with your children in mind. There are no high scores, failures, limits or stress. Your children can interact with the app at their own pace.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172046.name: SoulCraft
172046.description:
With humans on the brink to discover the secret of eternal life, angels and demons form a pact to proclaim the apocalypse to be able to materialize into the real world, fight the humans and keep the circle of life intact.

SoulCraft is a free2play Action RPG being developed by the indie game studio MobileBits. We are continuously improving the game and hope you will take this chance to shape the game with us together. We will constantly add lots of stuff and we will use your feedback to decide what to do next.

Play the game right now on Android, iOS, Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 or Amazon Kindle and please like us on Facebook!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
172047.description:
Description from the publisher:

In The Others, the world stands on the brink of apocalypse, as the fanatics of the Hell Club have summoned the 7 Deadly Sins to lay waste to our reality. Slowly the Others have creeped into our lives, corrupting society from within. The city of Haven is the key to their invasion, but it will not go down without a fight, thanks to the actions of the paranormal organization known as F.A.I.T.H. (Federal Authority for the Interdiction of Transdimensional Horrors). Each session of The Others is played with one player controlling the forces of a single Sin, against the other players who control a team of 7 FAITH heroes. The heroes cooperate to survive the Sin's attacks and accomplish the missions set before them, while the Sin attempts to thwart the heroes in all ways (preferably by destroying them).

The heroes are divided into different classes, each specialized in a different aspect of the game. Leaders are good at helping the other members of the team. Bruisers are excellent melee fighters. Snipers are experts at using guns to put down monsters from a distance. And Fixers have the resourcefulness and knowledge of the occult necessary to resolve supernatural crises that spread through the city. Each hero also has their own stats and unique abilities that set them apart from all others. Knowing when to bring in the right reinforcement can be key to FAITH’s victory.

Corruption is one of the main mechanics of the game. It is both a way for the Sin to consume heroes, and a way for heroes to accomplish amazing feats they wouldn’t be capable of normally. Taking corruption grants heroes powerful bonuses (as long as they keep taking corruption), but when they become fully corrupted, their darkest secrets may come back to haunt them and tear the team from within, or their flesh might simply succumb to the sinful influences.

The Sins player, on the other hand, has access to the different monsters of each Sin, including Abominations, a Controller, and the terrifying Avatar of Sin! These monsters can attempt to destroy the heroes, or simply hinder their progress on their missions. Each Sin provides the Sins Player with a different deck of Sins cards that can be played at different times to surprise players with different effects, often tied to the strategy of each Sin. Yes, because each Sin taints the game with an overarching mechanic that is always in effect. For example, Pride punishes prideful heroes that venture into the streets on their own, while Sloth punishes heroes who try to move quickly across the board. Heroes will need to learn to deal with the different influence of each Sin, which will always stand between them and their mission.

The Sins are also aided by Acolytes, with each session using a different type. These lowly corrupted servants of darkness can fight and stand in the way of heroes, but they also have a once per round special ability that reflects their previous lives. For example, corrupted hobos take equipment from heroes, corrupted nuns corrupt the city districts, and corrupted doctors keep heroes from healing.

There are 7 different stories that players can embark on for each session of The Others. Each of them brings different special rules, different dynamics, and a unique system of branching missions the heroes need to accomplish in order to be victorious. There are Terror stories, which are more straightforward, focusing on action and combat; Corruption stories revolve around the Corruption spreading through the city and the heroes themselves; and Redemption stories rely on saving the city and the few innocents that remain. Each story can be played on a different map setup, which further makes the dynamic of each session unique.

The board used in The Others is made up of several tiles, each depicting a different city district and different configurations of streets. As the city of Haven still belongs to humanity, and it’s the Sins that are attempting to take it over, the heroes can use it to get different benefits each district offers them. For example, they can go to the hospital to heal wounds, to the museum to get rid of corruption, to the RavenCorp tower to get new equipment, or to the police station to call in an orbital strike. What districts are available on each map, and their location, can greatly change the dynamic of the game.

As the game progresses, and depending on how badly the heroes fare against storyline plot twists and developments, the Apocalypse Track will advance, making the Sins gradually stronger and more terrifying. Apocalypse cards, tied to the type of story being played (Terror, Corruption, or Redemption) introduce new twists and challenges to the game, even bringing in the members of the Hell Club themselves!

Heroes will die. Either in noble sacrifice, torn apart by claws and tentacles, or consumed by the corruption welling up in their souls. The question is whether the FAITH team will manage to fulfill their final mission in time, or whether the Sins will reign supreme over humanity.
172047.name: The Others
boardgameexpansion: The Others: 7 Sins – Beta Team Expansion
The Others: 7 Sins – Delta Team Expansion
The Others: 7 Sins – Gamma Team Expansion

The Others: 7 Sins – Sons of Ragnarok Expansion

The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 129
The Good The Board and The Forgehaven: Episode 98 “Interview with Isaac Childres”

172049.name: SoulCraft II: League of Angels
172049.description:
SoulCraft 2 is the successor of the Action RPG SoulCraft and brings the all new League of Angels to the game. Challenge other players in asynchronous multiplayer matches and become the best SoulCraft player of the world.

You can choose from over 5 different heroes during the campaign without loosing your progress. Beat the new campaign, save the world, enjoy :)

Source: The Developer Website.

172050.name: Heroes of SoulCraft
172050.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Heroes of SoulCraft (HoS) gives you the full MOBA experience in quick accessible sessions across all plaforms:

• Angels vs. Demons team battle: accessible Arcade MOBA experience
• Play 5 or 15 minutes: instant matchmaking and short game times
• Choose your hero: Select one of 12+ heroes
• Easy to start — hard to master!
• Unleash your Titan: turn the tide of battle with your chosen titan
• True Cross-Platform: competitive matches across any device

Source: The Publisher Website.

172051.name: Wind-Up Knight 2
172051.description:
High-end platforming gameplay in a beautiful 3D world!
Your favorite clockwork automaton is back with a bigger world, crazy new mechanics, and even more insidious levels!
INCREDIBLE GRAPHICS
Double jumping over a spike trap while diving sword-first into a crazed Hippogriff never looked so good!
UNBEATABLE GAMEPLAY
Checkpoints, Bouncy Pads, Ice Blocks, Warps, Rolling Boulders, and a whole slew of new mechanics!
SIDE-QUESTS
Think you've got a level beat? Think again! Side-quests in every level force you to think outside the helmet!
TOURNAMENT MODE
School your leaderboard friends by playing a daily challenge on just one life!
CUSTOMIZE YOUR KNIGHT
Use power-ups and items to play your way.
Wind-up Knight has been played by ten million people. Wind-up Knight 2 turns all the dials up to 11.

Source: The Developer Website.

172053.name: Ice Age Adventures
172053.description:
Scrat's nutty pursuit of the cursed acorn has world-changing consequences. Manny, Diego, and the rest of the herd are suddenly floating out to sea at the edge of a continental cataclysm. Left all alone, Sid needs your help to rescue his friends and save the entire herd.

Get ready for ICE AGE ADVENTURES!

- Sail off on a new ICE AGE adventure full of adorable characters, exciting stories and hilarious fun!

- Explore uncharted environments with your favourite heroes: Sid, Manny and Diego!

- Eliminate obstacles, repair bridges, and defeat enemies to find the lost members of the herd.

- Save the day with a fun match-3 game and a delightful runner featuring Sid.

- Help Buck defeat iconic bosses in a special puzzle challenge.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172054.name: A Necromancer's Almanac: 2014
172054.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Necromancers Have Done It Again!

A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2014 is a compilation of all the material produced in 2014 for Necromancers of the Northwest’s popular article lines Best in Class, Extraordinary Feats, Obscure Arcana, and Exotic Encounters, plus a few additional extras scattered in. With over 180 pages of gaming content, it’s not hard to believe that this book was a full year in the making.

Somehow, we’ve managed to pack no less than 40 combined archetypes, bloodlines, and mysteries, over 180 feats (including 26 monster feats, allowing creative GMs to really make the most of their monsters’ special abilities), a whopping 152 spells, ranging from 0-level to 9th-level, and providing something for every spell list at every spell level, plus 30 brand new monsters and 10 new player races, all in one single, massive tome of exciting new content for your Pathfinder game.

Inside, you’ll find exciting and experimental new spells, which toy with taking magic in strange and unusual directions. You’ll find a feat for just about every occasion, and dozens of in-depth archetypes for lots of exciting and evocative staples of the fantasy genre. New to our lineup this year, you’ll also find an entire menagerie of strange and terrible monsters, and no less than 10 new player character races, each with their own racial archetype and alternate favored class bonuses. With A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2014, you’ll have all the options to make exactly the character you want.

And what’s more, you don’t have to search through dozens of articles to find it. Everything has been collected, archived, and gathered in an organized fashion, especially in the pdf version, which not only has extensive bookmarking, but also hyperlinked tables and spell lists, making navigation a breeze.

172055.name: Victory's Vault Volume 1, Issue 06
172055.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

You can call her Phane Wonderra... she represents an ancient race that pursues the practice of Victory, and if you've got the cash, she'll give you access to the vault of their star fortress. They've compiled quite a stock of items with one thing in common; they've all proved their value in battle by being on the winner's side. Every item has been literally touched by Victory! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Phae Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

172056.name: Mortal Kombat X
videogamehonor: 2014 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
172056.description:
The game is said to include a new, original and non-linear storyline showcasing some of the game's most prolific characters including Scorpion and Sub-Zero, while introducing new challengers that represent the forces of good and evil and tie the tale together.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mortal Kombat X", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

172057.name: Criminal Girls: Invite Only
172057.description:
User Summary

You are hired for a job and soon realize it isn’t a normal prison gig. You must watch seven delinquent girls, each guilty of one of the seven deadly sins. Their only hope of salvation is for you to guide them along the path to redemption.

172058.name: Deathtrap (2014)
172058.description:
User Summary

Jump back into the world of Ink from the Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing. Fight back the monsters who desire to jump through the portals that lead back to our world.

172059.name: Final Fantasy XIV: Heavensward
videogameexpansion: Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn
172059.description:
Final Fantasy XIV: Heavensward is the first expansion pack of Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn. Ishgard will be the main location of the storyline. Naoki Yoshida had revealed that the first expansion of the game will let the players fly.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172060.name: Cleverbot Evie
172060.description:
"Imagina a world in which humans talk to machines."

Evie talks using a combination of responses from Cleverbot and from Cleverscript.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172061.name: Deer Hunt Legends
172061.description:
User Summary

Deer Hunt Legends is a hunting simulation that features beasts found around the world and extinct ones such as woolly rhinos and saber-toothed cats.

172062.description:
In the Gloom card game, you assume control of the fate of an eccentric family of misfits and misanthropes. The goal of the game is sad, but simple: You want your characters to suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death.

Fairytale Gloom spreads that misery and suffering to the beloved, classic stories of your youth, like a magical, flying godmother ready to perturb you with peas, foil you with fairies, and surprise you with spiders.
172062.name: Fairytale Gloom
boardgameexpansion: Gloom: The Looking Glass Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 73- Two Player Games

172063.name: Ring it!
172063.description:
Ring it! includes ninety cards and a bell, along with rules for multiple games, all of which will be having you trying to ring that bell before anyone else.

The cards feature either a colored number or a picture of a bell, and at the start of each of the games you shuffle the cards and deal them face down among the players. Players take turns revealing cards one at a time and placing them face up in individual stacks. In one game you're looking for two cards of the same color, two of the same number, or two that feature a bell; whenever you see a combination like that, if you're the first to clap you hands, then ring the bell, you claim all of the cards in play. Run out of cards, and you're out of the game, with the last cardholder winning!

Other games have you looking for pairs of cards that sum to nine or a sandwich of two cards of the same color/number with another card in between them or even two number cards that sum to a third visible number card. Whatever the game, though, if you see two bell cards, you know that you need to clap and slap.

172064.name: Rally Up!
172064.description:
Description from the publisher:

What happens when 110 exotically illustrated cards are shuffled, distributed, then rhythmically turned face up on the table? Players will find themselves in a hullabaloo racing to rally up two or more images belonging to the same family! Scan swiftly through the craziness in Rally Up! to get these thingies back to where they belong!

172065.description:
DRK-Das Reich is the capstone game for the DRK-IISS game set. That is the final game in the 3 game set. This game builds on the first 2 in the set, DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte. This game focuses on the Das Reich sector of the southern part of the salient. After a good start and rapid movement this sector of the front became quiet. Das Reich, from 8 July, did little in the way of attacking. DRK-Totenkopf, at a minimum (and DRK-Leibstandarte is recommended), is required to play this game. The game system features the representation of units at Platoon and Battery level for the Germans and Company and Battery level for the Red Army. The Command and Control and Fire Support Enhancements are built into this game, just as they are for DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte. The Command and Control Enhancement provides Company sized replacement units for the Germans and the representation of communications between HQ (the concept of Radio Line of Sight is used) and the HQ ability to respond on its own initiative when commo is bad. The Fire Support Enhancement provides for artillery unit missions of Direct Support, General Support, and Reinforcing fires. This helps to restrict the fire of artillery in the game to something more like what happens in real life. Artillery cannot be gathered from around the map to support attacks or defense engagements. It must be planned.
Both of the previous 2 games start the battle from 9 July. This game does that and also provides a battle start, along the entire IISS front, from 4 July. The same game design features, from DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte, are included in this game.
There are 22 scenarios included. These include the Das Reich scenarios for 9-13 July plus a couple of smaller regimental scenarios, and daily scenarios for each day from 4-8 July for all 3 divisions. A real action packed monster.
172065.name: Death Ride Kursk: Das Reich

172066.description:
DRK-IISS is the Enhancement package for the DRK-IISS game set. This package provides the charts and counters necessary to play the detailed, or enhanced, rules for Air, Maintenance, and Logistics, for the IISS Panzer Korps area of the battle.
The Air Enhancement provides the Air units and supporting charts and tables to recreate the air war in a more detailed manner. Air units can conduct Close Air Support (CAS), Combat Air Patrol (CAP), Escort, Interception, Airfield Ground Attack, Ground Attack (GA), and Interdiction missions.

The Maintenance Enhancement provides units that represent the Recovery units for recovering wrecks on the battlefield. Battlefield recovery can be tricky when the enemy is nearby. This is just one of the many issues you will need to consider when planning to recover wrecked units. And if you lose these units then your ability to get replacements is seriously hampered.
The Logistics Enhancement provides supply convoy units that are required to move supplies to units and around the battlefield and has a more natural use of supplies in the structure of unit organizations.
172066.name: Death Ride Kursk: IISS Enhancement

172067.description:
Incredible Courage 100 Days: Quatre Bras starts a 4 game set that explores Napoleon’s 100 Days campaign that ended his reign and finished his aspirations as emperor of France. This game expands on the feature set started with the Incredible Courage at Austerlitz series and followed with Incredible Courage at Elchingen. One of the expanded items is doctrine specific rules for the various combatants. Each of the Anglo-Allied countries had some specific doctrinal distinctions that must be presented to the players. There are also now cavalry regiment counters, in addition to the infantry battalion counters. And there are now leaders that have some special capabilities in the areas of handling infantry, cavalry, or artillery.
There are 5 scenarios included in this game and 2 of them are very small in terms of unit density. These scenarios include “The Battle of Quatre Bras”, “15 June 1815” (very small), “Counter-Attack at Thyle” (very small), “Hooves of Destruction”, and “The Guard Attacks”.
This is the base game in the set and is required in order to play the follow on games of Ligny, Wavre, and Waterloo. These games feature the final map artwork of Rick Barber.
172067.name: Incredible Courage 100 Days:  Quatre Bras

172068.description:
Demi: Labyrinth of the Gods is a cooperative game where each player takes on the role of a modern day demigod (there are eight to choose from). These 2-4 players must then work together to navigate a labyrinth that shifts and changes as you play, while trying to accomplish the task of finding three ancient artifacts the gods have demanded in order to prove your worth and gain access to the exit - but there's a catch! This labyrinth is filled with mythic monsters and traps...

This is a tile-based game. A grid of thirty face-down tiles represent rooms within the labyrinth. Players move together as one, flipping over a room to move into it, one room at a time. To represent the fact that the Labyrinth is always in motion, when the players enter a new room they choose the orientation of that room (provided one entrance/exit points back the way they came). They then replace the room they came from with a room from the next difficulty tier.

Within each room they draw from an encounter deck and face off against monsters out of Greek mythology, traps, or if lucky - a pile of resources they can use to upgrade their gear or utilize their special abilities.

Each of the eight demigods has three special abilities: A Free Ability they can utilize anytime the text applies, a Cost Ability they can pay resources they've gathered to activate, and a Coin-Flip ability they receive later in the game, letting them tempt the fates for a positive or potentially negative outcome.

Winning means reaching opposite corners three times to gather the three artifacts, then back once more to find the exit - the shifting rooms that are constantly replaced as you progress means player tactics in room orientation to determine the route become a deciding factor in the group's ability to make it out alive.
172068.name: Demi: Labyrinth of the Gods

172069.name: De Jongens Tegen De Meisjes
172069.description:
Translated from the Box:

Once and for all decide which sex is the strongest!
De Jongens Tegen De Meisjes (The Boys Against the Girls) is a battle between men and women. In seven different rounds plus a final round two teams play against each other. Bet on the opponent's answers wisely and collect the most coins to win the game.

172070.name: Thorobred
172070.description:
Seems to be a simple race game with dice. The set includes d6 dice, 6 plastic horses with jockey (yellow, white, black, green, red and blue) and a board with 6 lanes which has a number of spaces marked off. Guessing that the main game is a simple race to end of row and back which would be about 30 spaces.

Boxtop has a race trail rail from left right and curving around back to right. Above rail mostly red and below yellow. "Thorobred" is at the top of the box, in yellow print on the red backtop. There are four horses showing on left side of box.

172071.name: Donjon: A Dice Game
172071.description:
A dice-rolling game where you (and up to 5 more friends) explore an ancient dungeon with monsters and treasure! Defeat the boss monster, and win the game!

On each of your turn, navigate the dungeon to encounter monsters and treasure. If you encounter a monster, only one of you lives!

172073.description:
In the card game MammuZ, also released as Sauries, you'll see mammoths, sabretooth tigers, and other critters from long-gone days — and you want to help them disappear by ridding yourself of them as quickly as you can.

MammuZ uses an asymmetrical deck of cards featuring two mammoths, three bears, four deer, and so on up to nine mice. Six dinosaur cards with special powers are included as well, and you customize the deck before the start of play based on the number of players.

During the game, players try to rid themselves of cards along the lines of Cheat. At the start of a round, a player lays 1-4 cards face down and claims they're a type of animal, which they may or may not be! The next player either also lays down 1-4 cards and claims they're the same type of animal or calls out the previous player by flipping over one of the cards previously played. If that card matches the animal claimed, the current player takes all played cards in hand; if not, the previous player does. If the card revealed is a dinosaur, then some special power takes effect. Whatever the case, the next player then starts a new round.

Whenever a player has all cards of a particular type of animal in hand, they discard those animals immediately, removing them from the game.

As soon as a player runs out of cards, whether by discarding a type of animal or by playing their final cards (and not being proved a liar), the game ends and they win!
172073.name: MammuZ
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82

172075.name: Fish Out Of Water!
172075.description:
Fish Out Of Water is a light, fun and colorful game featuring an adorable cast of characters in a huge seafaring celebration!

Instantly playable for all ages, Fish Out Of Water tells the story of a group of fish (and mammals!) longing to soar above the ocean and see the world from a whole new perspective.

Play Fish out of Water for FREE today!

Source: The Publisher Website.

172077.name: Tabletop Simulator
videogamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Game Within A Game Award Nominee
172077.description:
Tabletop Simulator is for everyone! Play a simple board game with grandma, have poker night with the guys, or start your epic RPG adventure with your regulars. Play almost any tabletop game you can think of! Being a multiplayer-focused game, up to 8 players can play at any given time. You can also play a solo game of Solitaire if you just need to relax by yourself.

Source: The Developer Website.

172078.name: Zucchini
172078.description:
SQUASH the competition in the farming game that grows on you!

Share a plot of land between your friends and compete to harvest the most zucchini. During your turn, you have the choice to lengthen a vine or grow a zucchini in size. Once you grow a zucchini to 3 cards in length, draw an Action Card. You might get to fertilize your plants, kill your opponents' chances with blight, or harvest a vine for points. The first player to 30 points is the winner!

It's time to get growing.

172079.name: Altered Earth
172079.description:
From the Chapter 1 of the Book:

Altered Earth is a role-playing game of high energy battles and thrilling adventures set against an epic science fiction background. The action takes place in a futuristic world filled with endless possibilities. Any kind of adventure that you can imagine is waiting for you in a setting that is filled with dangerous wastelands, high tech cities, awesome war machines, and unexplored ruins.

172080.name: TreeForts
172080.description:
Who can build the most AWESOMEST TreeFort?
August 1978 – no computers; no cable TV; no money; no girlfriend; and no grown-ups around to nag about chores! School’s gonna start next week and you’re sick and tired of hanging at the mall and the local swimming hole. “What do you wanna do today?”…”I don’t know, what do YOU wanna do?” “Hey, let’s build some tree forts!”

Tree Forts is a fast-paced and surprisingly strategic card/board game that will take you back to the days of lava lamps, Atari video game consoles, and lazy afternoons spent scavenging for stuff to add to your fort. Players compete to determine whose fort is best - but be careful - your neighbor might have some water balloons or a mud flinger to pelt your fort (and damage your chances of winning)!

Players start with a Pallet card and use candy and resources to purchase and build additions to their forts. Each addition has a point value and when you reach a certain point value you win. Player interaction occurs through mud flingers and water balloons that may be used to remove points from player's additions.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
172081.description:
Burgle Bros. is a cooperative game for 1-­4 players. Players are unique members of a crew trying to pull off a robbery of a highly secure building — without getting caught. The building has three floors (4x4 tiles), each with its own safe to crack. Players start on the first floor and have to escape to their helicopter waiting on the roof.

Players each have three stealth tokens. Whenever they are on the same tile with a guard, they lose one. If any player is caught without a stealth token, the game is over. If players can open all three safes, and escape through the stairs to the roof they win.
172081.name: Burgle Bros.
boardgameexpansion: Burgle Bros.: Bonus Event – Alter Ego
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 103 - Burgle Bros.
BGA Ep 64 - Controversy in Tabletop Gaming
Ep 37 Randomness
Ep. 18 – Top 10 Filler Games & Jason Kotarski | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode #224 - The Spiel on Burgle Bros
Episode 14 - Le Havre Review
Episode 2 - A-B-C, 1-2-3
Episode 22 - We All Stand Together
Perfect Information Episode 16 -  It's a hard knock life
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 122
The Long View - Quick Looks #11
Vox Republica 076: The Giant PAX East 2015 Recap
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 50!!! Featuring a Patrick Hillier review of Elder Sign, AnnaBeth and her Story Cubes and Kerensa joins me again!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 76

172082.name: Six Nights at Suzie's
172082.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Six Nights at Suzie’s has been mentioned by the publisher to copy the game-play of Five Nights At Freddy's. Try to survive six nights as a security guard at Suzie’s. The game was only available for a VERY limited amount of time before criticism and backlash forced them to remove it.

172083.name: Halls of the Minotaur
172083.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for 0-Level Characters

The adventure Halls of the Minotaur was originally published in the limited-run boxed set DCC #35: Gazetteer of the Known Realms, which has been out of print for many years. Long been sought after by collectors, Halls of the Minotaur is finally being reprinted in a stand-alone format! This limited-edition “mini-module” reproduces the original version in its entirety, utilizing the original 3.5-edition rules.

A villainous minotaur has been terrorizing the village for months, slaying villagers at random and slipping away with stolen children. A heroic paladin comes to the rescue, pursuing the minotaur to its lair in the Thornswild Forest. When the paladin fails to return, it falls to the village farmers, mere commoners, to discover his fate and to save the village from the minotaur’s depredations. The trail of the knight leads the heroes past deadly kobold traps, natural dangers, packs of feral dogs, and to the foot of a mysterious basalt tower in the heart of the woods...

172084.name: The Psion
172084.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whoever said “work smarter, not harder” probably didn’t have you in mind.

Without lifting a finger you can move objects about, from tiny stones to massive boulders, or crush the bodies of those that would harm or impede you. You can transmit your thoughts over great distances, and force your way into the minds of others.

And that’s just the beginning.

With time and experience you can hurl objects about with great force, and tear people asunder. Or maybe you’d prefer to delve deep into their memories and claim them for yourself? Who knows, you might learn a trick or two.

It all depends on what you have a mind to do.

This product contains two files:

The first is a digest-sized, 25 page book laid out like the Dungeon World rulebook. It contains:

The psion playbook: move objects and beat monsters up with mind bullets, communicate telepathically, and hear the thoughts of others.
20 advanced moves that let you move larger objects with ease, knock enemies about, communicate telepathically with multiple creatures at once, defend yourself through sheer willpower, impose your will on others, take moves from others, and more!
New gear and loot: weapon and armor enhancements, psychic capacitors, preservation jars (for storing brains), psionic poisons, and a few new magic items.
A behind the scenes look at our design, expanded explanation of some of the moves, and five additional advanced moves that just wouldn't fit on the sheet.
The other is a 2-page, letter-sized character sheet with custom graphics for you to print and play with.

172085.name: The Hunter
172085.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure module for use with Nightshade Academy: Core Curriculum.

Kidnapped by a hunter who prefers to hunt people, can a group of Nightshade Academy students survive the night and make it home alive?

172086.name: Night at the Parasol Factory
172086.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure module for use with Nightshade Academy: Core Curriculum.

When people start going missing and thefts are reported all over the city of London, its up to a group of Nightshade Academy students to figure out what's going on...and possibly to save the city itself.

172087.name: The Three Lives of Fantomah: Daughter of the Pharoahs
172087.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE RETURN OF THE QUEEN

In the third and final collection of Fantomah tales from NUELOW Games, the Mystery Woman of the Jungle discovers her destiny and is restored to the throne of the City of Khefra. But danger lurks in every shadow, as jealous priestesses, dark-hearted adventurers, and the evil Spotted Men have designs on her crown and intents to end her life.

The Three Lives of Fantomah: Daughter of the Pharoahs contains seven rarely seen tales of adventure from the Golden Age of Comics and an all-new OGL d20 roleplaying game supplement spotlighting eight gods worhiped in Khefra, together with feats that give supernatural powers to their favored mortals. These rules are easily incorporated into any RPG using the d20 game system, and are fully compatible with the game material presented in Fantomah: Mystery Woman of the Jungle and [rpgitem=168623 Fantomah: Guardian of the Jungle.

172088.name: Fliip Football
172088.description:
Tabletop football game for two players. Easy game-play matches real football stats. Unique Fliip play solution creates fast-paced action.

Includes two complete matched teams with offense and defense play cards along with special teams kick tables. Track the down-and-distance with with clear marker cards on the flexible field mat.

Each team has 12 offense and 12 defense plays. Offense and defense can choose their personnel and can be either aggressive or conservative. Offense can pick from run or pass plays. Defense can pick a focus area of the field. The 144 possible outcomes match real football averages at the play and possession levels. Try playing with your own personal game-plan or style. You can be a conservative team that runs the ball and controls field-position. Or you can be a wide-open passing team that takes aggressive risks on defense.

The Flip play solution is a diagrammatical solution of the offense and defense play pairing. Each offense play-card has a play arrow which is positioned in one of six lanes. Each defense play-card has play outcome arrows in each of these lanes. The cards are aligned and the offense play arrow will line up with one of the defense outcome arrows yielding the outcome of the card pairing and the play.

Each team has three kick tables for kick-offs, punts, and field goals. These tables are used with three dice and the results match real football stats.

Four possessions per side is a quick game (30 minutes) and eight possessions per side is a qood game (60 minutes).

172089.name: Mini PolyStation 3
172089.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the PlayStation 3.




User Summary

The Mini PolyStation 3 is a knock-off of the PS3 and requires 3 AA batteries and the controller is placed at the back of the console. The console also features a screen, which partially pops out when pushed.

It has seven games: Formula 1, Soccer, Basketball, Motorbike Race, Street Fighter, Submarine Invasion, and Space Guardian.

172090.name: Game Theory Admiral
172090.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Game Boy.




User Summary

Game Theory Admiral is a knock-off of the Game Boy and through the use of an NES or Famicom cartridge converter, it can play NES games. Cartridges hang over the console and it only supports the Japanese release versions. It can output video to your TV.

boardgamecompilation: De Weerwolven Van Wakkerdam: Het Pact
172091.description:
Werewolf: Full Moon is an expansion to Corey Fields' version of Werewolf.


Instructions Book
28 Cards
2 Wolf Pup cards
2 Spirit cards
1 Elder card
2 Skinwalker card
2 Thief cards
2 Zombie cards
2 Vampyre cards
1 Moderator card
2 Inventor cards
1 Dolos card
2 Drunkard cards
1 Leader card
2 Alpha cards
1 Harlot card
1 Idiot card
1 Lycan card
1 Butcher card
1 Gypsy card
1 Diseased card
172091.name: Werewolf: Full Moon Expansion

172092.name: Neo Double Games
172092.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Nintendo DS.




User Summary

Neo Double Games is a knock-off of the DS and has two screens that are interchangeable game cartridges. There are four available games: Soccer, Submarine Invasion, Fortress Guardian, and Street Fighter. The system comes packaged with two games and the bottom screen does not work, instead acting as a holder.

172093.name: Nintendo PolyStation
172093.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the PlayStation.




User Summary

The Nintendo PolyStation is a knock-off of the PlayStation. It has Nintendo in the name, an N64 type box, and copies the Super Nintendo cartridges. It uses Namco games.

172094.name: Chitendo Vii
172094.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Wii.




User Summary

Chitendo Vii is a knock-off of the Wii that competes in the "plug-in TV game" genre of inexpensive consoles with built-in games. It's developers actually create unique games for it.

172095.name: Werewolf: All Hallows' Eve Expansion
boardgameversion: Werewolf: All Hallows' Eve Expansion Kickstarter
172095.description:
Werewolf: All Hallows' Eve Expansion added 11 new cards to Corey Fields' version of Werewolf.


22 cards, 2 each of the following
White Wolf
Artist
Devil
Cleric
Lunatic
Scarecrow
Monster
Banshee
Jack
Creature
Death

172096.name: Super Megason
172096.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the PlayStation and Super Nintendo Entertainment System.




User Summary

Super Megason is a knock-off of the PlayStation or Super Nintendo. The disc or cartridge slot is used solely for decoration.

172097.name: Mega Drive Extreme
172097.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Xbox and PlayStation Controller.




User Summary

Mega Drive Extreme is a knock-off of the Xbox but has PlayStation style controllers. It will only play Sega Genesis games.

172098.name: PXP-2000
172098.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the PSP.




User Summary

The PXP-2000 is a knock-off of the PSP and will play downloadable 16-bit Rom Games, has a built-in Camera, FM radio, drag n drop mp3/mp4, loudspeaker, card slot, and tv-out. It also has a built in Emulator that will play emulated NES/Famicom games and Gameboy/Gameboy Color.

172099.name: PX-3600
172099.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Xbox 360 S.




User Summary

PX-3600 is a knock-off of the Xbox 360 that has a disc drive that doesn't open. Only pre-installed games can be played. The controllers may or may not vibrate.

172100.name: W! Vision
172100.description:
UNLICENSED/IMITATION HARDWARE




This hardware item is an unlicensed variation or imitation of the Wii.




User Summary

W! Vision is a knock-off of the Wii that has 240x240 resolution and 64 bit colors.

172101.name: Werewolf: Silent Night Expansion
172101.description:
Werewolf: Silent Night Expansion adds 23 Christmas themed cards to Corey Fields Kickstarter Werewolf deck.


23 Cards, 2 each of the following cards
Santa
Krampus
Naughty
Nice
Elf
Reindeer
Spriggan
Esteru
Winter
Gryla
Boreas
Yeti (bonus card, one copy)

172102.name: Dragon Ball Z: For Kinect
172102.description:
During battles, the player retains control only over limited movement and dodging technique. Returned by "spectacular camera movements in an anime style", the fighting system requires the player to carry their body with every movement and every shot so that the character executes them on the screen. It results in a true fusion of "breathtaking cinematic and immerse gameplay".

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Ball Z: For Kinect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

172103.name: Toukiden: Kiwami
172103.description:
User Summary

Toukiden: Kiwami is an enhanced and expanded Toukiden: The Age of Demons. The protagonist's home and its habitants have been protected and three months pass until a new threat emerges. The protagonist must work with different factions to fight against a giant demon swarm. The game features twice the number of demons, two new characters, extended story and new equipment. Additional weapons introduced in the new version include firearms, naginata and kanabō. In addition, there are new character abilities.

172104.name: Runes: The Forgotten Path
172104.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




User Summary

Runes: The Forgotten Path uses motion control to make you feel like a wizard. To cast a spell, the player has to gesture the elemental rune and an archetype rune.

172105.name: Ultimate General: Gettysburg
172105.description:
Ultimate General: Gettysburg is a tactical battle simulator that allows you to lead thousands of soldiers in the famous battle of Gettysburg as commander of either the Union or Confederate army.

The game features the most accurately created map, complex morale, innovative control mechanics and smart AI. You have the freedom to use different strategies while the battle progresses. Your decisions and military performance play a crucial role in the result.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172106.description:
Let’s go see the Wizard of Oz

Based on the public domain book The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is a children’s novel written by L. Frank Baum and illustrated by W. W. Denslow.

Follow the Yellow Brick Road is a tabletop game. It is a bit like Candyland but with some strategy.

Help Dorothy, the Lion, the Scarecrow and the Tin Man in their quest to find the Wonderful Wizard of Oz. Follow a path with many challenges and stunning surprises in this fun game for 2 to 4 players aged between 9 and 99 year old (more or less).

Play a game in 15 to 30 minutes with a balance mix of chance and strategy. Will you be the first to reach the Emerald Castle? Will the Good Witch of the North help you with Silver Shoes? Beware of the Wicked Witch of the West and her Winged Monkeys. The Wonderful Wizard of Oz will bring more surprises.
172106.name: Follow the Yellow Brick Road

172107.description:
Tentacles are cropping up all over the place and they're reaching for YOU! But you can trick the tentacles into going after someone else. Are you quick enough to rid yourself of all those grasping tentacles? Or are your friends quicker? Only one way to find out!

This game will accommodate 3 to 8 players (ages 8 and up).

OBJECT OF THE GAME: Be the person with the least number of Tentacles in your hand at the end of the 9th turn.

TO PLAY: Determine who the dealer is by whoever owns the most tentacles... or failing that, any manner that suits you. Each player will start with three cards in hand. During each turn, you and your fellow players will simultaneously pass cards to the left and right. After all cards have been passed, the players will then pick up the cards passed to them and draw a new card from the deck. Once everyone has drawn a new card, the turn is over, and it's time to move on to the next turn!
172107.name: Pass The Tentacle
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 5

172109.name: Space Wars
172109.description:
Space Wars was the brainchild of Larry Rosenthal, an MIT graduate who was fascinated with the original Spacewar! and developed his own custom hardware and software so that he could play the game. Rosenthal shopped the game to various manufacturers, demanding an unheard-of 50% split of the profits. Only Cinematronics was willing to take him up on the offer.

Two players controlled different ships. One button rotated the ship left, another rotated the ship right, one engaged thrust, one fired a shell, and one entered hyperspace (which causes the ship to disappear and reappear elsewhere on the playfield at random).

The game offered a number of gameplay options, including the presence or absence of a star in the middle of the playfield (which exerted a positive or negative gravitational pull), whether the edges of the playfield "wrapped around" to their opposite sides, and whether shells bounced. Three other fascinating features were unique to this game. First, the game could not be played in "one player" mode; a human opponent was required. Second, the player's ship could take a glancing hit without dying, but would suffer damage; a cloud of loose ship fragments would break off and float away, after which the ship would be visibly damaged on screen and would turn and accelerate more slowly. Third and most memorable was that the duration of play for any contest was solely governed by the amount of money deposited; each quarter bought a minute and a half of play. A dollar bought six minutes, and for a ten dollar roll of quarters two players could play non-stop for an hour.

Space Wars formed the basis of the platform used by Cinematronics into the early '80s. Most of their subsequent black and white vector games (such as Star Castle and Tail Gunner) were based on this basic custom design.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Wars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

172110.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Catapult Pizza
172110.description:
Information from the back of the box:

Use your ninja skills to knock down villains (Shredder, Kraang Droid, and Foot Clan Soldier) by hitting them with pizzas launched from your pizza catapult! With four catapults launching pizzas at the sae time, it's pies to the sky, dude.

172111.name: Tower Seven
172111.description:
Tower Seven puts you in the shoes of a 1980s action hero. During a public unveiling of Tower Corporation's new product, terrorists have taken over the main facility and are searching for a dangerous technology prototype. Trapped in the building, it's up to you to find what they are after, thwart their escape, and save the hostages.

Tower Seven is a cooperative strategy card game set in a 1980s office tower that has been taken over by terrorists. Via exploration, card play and die rolls, you will battle villains to find items and clues of their ultimate plan.

To win, you must find all the clues, recover the item card the clues pointed you towards, stop the escape plan, and ultimately defeat the final boss. The game includes a Threat Level mechanic that rises when certain events occur in-game. If the Threat Level reaches too high, hostages may be executed and you may lose the game.

Upon winning, a scoring system helps you determine how well you did versus the game. Multiple variants and difficulty levels are available to aid replayability.

172113.name: Lek og lær: farver + former + mengder
172113.description: An educational game aimed at preschoolers, where the point is to match shapes, colours and numbers. It is played as a lotto game – tiles are drawn from a pool, and are placed on matching squares on the players' boards. The twist is that the active player does not show the tile to the others, but instead calls out the type, colour and number of shapes depicted (e. g. "six red triangles"). The first to cover all squares on their board is the winner.

172114.name: A Very English Murder: Murder at Woodperry Hall
172114.description:
The year is 1955 and everything seems quite normal in the village of Thornbury and its most famous residence, the stately—yet slightly run-down—Woodperry Hall. England has been at peace for a decade, the family and guests are at the Hall for a evening meal, the cook has prepared a delightful supper, and the staff have arranged the summer’s mauve and white flowers in crystal vases in impecible fashion. Everything is simply tip-top ... except for the still-warm body found on the grounds of Woodperry Hall. Was it murder or suicide? Was it simply an accident, or something far more sinister? Oh, without a doubt it’s murder alright, and now Oxford City Police detectives will arrive and dramatically solve the case. Who will be discovered to have commited the crime?

A Very English Murder: Murder at Woodperry Hall is a three- to eight-player murder mystery game set in the fictional village of Thornbury, near Oxford, England in 1955. It is a narrative game where players cooperatively construct a story about a murder that takes place by answering questions and trying to appear innocent. Each player assumes the role of a character who is frequently found in classic English murder mystery novels. Every turn, one player assumes the role of an Oxford City Police Detective to question the other players who, in turn, build a case against each other to make sure another character is responsible for the murder that took place. At the end of the game, the Detective will solve the crime and—in dramatic fashion—reveal who the murderer is. Will you turn out to be the one who committed the murder?

172115.description:
“Moew~! Those boxes are mine. All mine!”
It’s known that cats are obsessed with cardboard boxes and in Cat Box they fight for them!

Goal of the game
Players will have a secret CAT color (identity) and the winner is the player with the most cats visible of his type in the center of the table when the game ends.

Components
Cat cards x 20 (double-sided will either cats or empty boxes in 2 x 2 grid)
Cat Identity card x 4 (1 of each color)

Player turn

1) Player chooses one out of two possible actions:

a) Play a card from hand

b) Use a card from another player's hand

2) Draw back up to 2 cards.

Game End
The game ends when all players have no cards in hands. Players reveal their Cat identities and count the number of their cats that are visible in the table. Each visible cat earns the corresponding player 1 victory point (VP).
172115.name: Cat Box Lite

172116.name: Fantastic Four
boardgamecompilation: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
172116.description:
Publisher's Description:

Find the Fantastic Four! You want the Fantastic Four team--Mr. Fantastic, Human Torch, Invisible Woman, and The Thing--to go on an exploration mission with you. You must reach them all before you can fly away with them. But Dr. Doom, Mole Man, and Annihilus are out there to prevent you from carrying out your plan. However, you can count on Silver Surfer to give you a helping hand.

Fantastic Four was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play.

Each player starts with four markers and rolls two dice (or in this case presses the "electronic die" twice), multiplying the numbers. They then place a marker on a space that displays the resulting number. If another marker is already on the space, the marker must be placed on another matching space. If the square has instructions, the player follows those instructions. If the player lands on a space with a villain, their marker is stuck there until all other markers are placed. A Silver Surfer space allows the player to move the marker to any space. The first player to place one marker on each member of the Fantastic Four wins.

172117.name: Monster Hunters Guide to Vampires
172117.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many horrid monsters that lurk in the dark places of the world, but none is as cruel or terrifying as the vampire. These immortal fiends exist in an unnatural state between life and death, but they walk undetected among their living prey. They are intelligent, sadistic, patient, and thirsty for human blood. Only the bravest and most skilled monster hunters dare to challenge one of the lords of the night, and most of them die a fool's death. There are many legends concerning vampires, but only some of them are true. Knowing the true nature of the enemy is the only way to survive an encounter with a blood-drinking prince of undeath.

This source book for the Monster Hunters RPG contains:

Background on European vampires: their habits, their motivations, and most importantly, how to track and kill them.
Stats for different types of vampires, vampire variants, and rules for creating your own unique monsters * Known vampires of Europe: histories, background, and habits
A collection of vampire servants and related monsters
New feats and equipment

172118.description:
Cave Pilot 55 is an 'Arcade' card-board game where 1-4 players race their sophisticated technological bat-planes through a gauntlet cave. Players jointly contribute to the construction of the cave.

The goal of the game is to finish alive with the most experience points gained during the race.

Each turn, player's put a small part of the cave on the table, representing either the ceiling or the floor of the cave. By doing so, a long small cave is created on which different dangerous objects or animals (vampiric bat, giant centipedes, laser beams, etc) are shown. During movement the bat-planes fly either along the cave ceiling or along the cave floor until they arrive at a cave and have to encounter its horrors. The dice-fight that follows during an encounter can be won (experience points are gained) or lost, depending on the strength and equipment of the bat-plane. Players can strengthen their bat-planes by upgrading various parts of their plane (shields, short-range attack, plate armor, power, maneuverability and navigation & control), however only at specific locations in the cave. Players can not only invest their money in upgrades, they can also decide to buy long-range missiles or booster fuel. The long-range missiles can be used to shoot rivals, caves and obstructions. Booster fuel is used to outmaneuver other players by playing an extra turn or to move diagonally. Some cave locations also offer the possibility to explore the local environment, and with a bit of luck player's might find special upgrades there.

Each game, the layout, the length and the difficulty of the cave is different. It is a tactical game, thrilling to the last turn, based on a few simple rules, in a steampunk sci-fi technological world, where players have to continually cope with limited resources.
172118.name: Cave Pilot 55
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 3

172119.description:
User Summary:
Among a group of detectives there is the perpetrator of a murder.

The culprit is one of the players, and the other players become detectives. The players investigate the "time of the crime", "weapon", "motivation" and "perpetrator" of this incident. The detective who manages to correctly identify these four elements wins. Otherwise, it will be the culprit's victory.

Will any detective manage to identify the culprit's trick and find the evidence to drive a confession from the culprit!?

Designer Summary:

探偵達の中に殺人事件の犯人が紛れ込んでいます。
プレイヤーの一人が犯人、他のプレイヤーが探偵となり、この事件の「犯行時間」「凶器」「動機」そして「犯人」を調査していきます。
全てを言い当てることができればその探偵の勝利。誰も犯人を当てられなければ、犯人の勝利となります。
探偵達は、犯人押しかけるトリックを見破り、すべての証拠を突きつけ、犯人を自白に追いやることができるでしょうか！？
boardgameversion: 日本第 1 版 (First Japanese edition)
172119.name: Criminal 're In Detective

172120.name: Roo Race
172120.description: Players race as kangaroos to the finish line, dodging obstacles, and sabotaging the plans of others in the Outback. Each kangaroo has a special ability and can use that ability along with purchasing Item Cards to give them an edge in the race. When two kangaroos land in the same space they box each other and betting takes place. It's a fight to the finish line.

172121.name: Disrupting Weapons
172121.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Innovations focuses on one spell and offers several variants and enhanced spells built upon the foundation of the original spell. This installment looks at the Disrupting Weapon spell and includes ten variant spells built around this tried and true divine spell.

172122.name: Eldritch Ghost Hunter
172122.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you afraid of ghosts? Don't be, the Eldritch Ghost Hunter is here to kick their undead butts!

A new hybrid class dedicated to exterminating undead, especially malevolent spirits. Grab your ghostly companion, your specialy crafted soul trap, and get ready to hunt some ghosts!

172123.name: Pacifier Angel
172123.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Mindblast! Villains Augmented. This is the first in a series of psionic supplements designed to help you run games using the rules from Psionics Unleashed by Dreamscarred Press.

This product aims to give you a monsters with a psionic flair with a single, detailed nemesis for cheap. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here.

Presented here is a magnificent specimen of the angelic host, the Pacifier Angel!

172124.name: Sunset
videogamehonor: 2015 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Best Music/Sound Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Winner
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee
172124.description:
Sunset is a narrative-driven first-person videogame that takes place in a single apartment in a fictional South American city in the early 1970s. You play a housekeeper called Angela Burnes. Every week, an hour before sunset, you visit the swanky bachelor pad of Gabriel Ortega. You are given a number of tasks to do, but the temptation to go through his stuff is irresistible. As you get to know your mysterious employer better, you are sucked into a rebellious plot against a notorious dictator Generalísimo Ricardo Miraflores.

Source: The Developer Website.

172125.name: Catfolk!
172125.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Catfolk! includes new racial feats, catfolk character traits, and alternate racial traits for catfolk. In addition, this product features a new archetype for catfolk rangers: the Predatory Prowler!

172126.name: Skirmish Dice: Cursed Artifacts
172126.description:
Ancient and mysterious entities, known only as Artifacts, drift from planet to planet engulfing entire civilizations. They travel together, appear on a planet, and cause nations to frenzy. Most recently, they appeared on Gallia. Players represent factions fighting for control of these Artifacts. Some want them destroyed entirely. Some simply don’t want them in enemy hands. And still, others want to use their power to enslave the world. Players will have to build their teams and enter the battlefield. Lose, and you have failed your people, perhaps your entire civilization.

Skirmish Dice is a customizable skirmish game. Using powerful leaders, sizable brutes, clever totems, and more, players customize their teams and send them into battle. Units are represented by dice on the field, and each unit’s corresponding card holds its actions, abilities, statistics, and more. The game is highly tactical and meant to move, meaning you can get the experience of a skirmish/squad level miniatures or card game in a smaller timeframe.

While the units are dice, the game doesn’t suffer from luck-induced chaos. The dice faces are significant to character abilities and are rolled to receive offensive and defensive bonuses. It’s streamlined and quick to learn, but the strategy runs deep as team building can offer hundreds of combinations within factions.

172128.name: Encyclopédie Galactique – tome I
172128.description:
Translated from the website:

This volume of Encyclopédie Galactique gives an history of the game universe, from the beginning of the interplanetary era to the 116th century. It is followed by a description of the Empire institution: the Central Power, the Chambers as well as the Guilds.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1

172129.name: Encyclopédie Galactique – tome II
172129.description:
Translated from the website:

This volume of Encyclopédie Galactique is dedicated to the Great Universe. It describe the Space where the Empire spread and also the Triche-Lumière (Light-Cheat), this parallel dimension where hyperlight spaceships navigate. This book also contains some rules for piloting ships and fight dangers.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1

172130.name: Encyclopédie Galactique – tome III
172130.description:
Translated from the website:

This volume of Encyclopédie Galactique describe the two type of faster-than-light spaceships available in the Empire, the small Varlet and the gigantic Lehouine. This books also contains the rules needed to build these and fight, as well as spatial artifacts (spaceports, orbital stations) and antigrav propulsion.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1

172131.name: Encyclopédie Galactique: Tome IV
172131.description:
Translated from the website:

This volume of Encyclopédie Galactique contain two chapters.

The first one describe the imperial society, how its justice work as well as its laws for trade and communications.

The second one is a catalogue of equipment and misc object in various area, from the shoulder blaster to the tabletop antigrav by way of the flight belt or contact localizer. In addition you'll find some supplementary rules.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2

172132.name: Encyclopédie Galactique: Tome V
172132.description:
Translated from the website:

This volume of Encyclopédie Galactique contain all the rules needed to make characters advance beyond grade 3. It contains two chapters:

The first describe the process by which characters have access to advanced careers, and describe for each Guild a list of 6 possible specialisationss.

The second is a catalog of 30 new advanced skills including psionics ; some new rules how to use these powers as well as tables to allow giving personality traits to characters.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2

172133.name: Encyclopédie des Varlets
172133.description:
Translated from the website:

This extra volume of the Encyclopedia exhibit 10 Varlet spaceships, with a larger format artwork and the corresponding stats for use in the game.

This is a republication with permission of parts of Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1 and Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2

172134.name: Le Livre du Rôle
172134.description:
This is a republication with permission of parts of Empire Galactique

From the original item:

This is a Space Opera RPG set in the 116th century. Players are members of a Empire who span across the entire galaxy. The background is quite light, for allow any type of SF adventure to take place.

This is, of course, a French "Traveller".

Translated from the website:

This is the player's handbook for Empire Galactique. It contains rules for creating your PC, the description of careers and basic skills, rules on experience and destiny as well as some equipment sorted by technological level.

172135.name: Seafari Under the Sea
172135.description: Seafari Under the Sea is a spin-and-move game where players move around a track of bubbles "under the sea." Each player has a puzzle picture card, and all the puzzle pieces are face-down on the table. As they move, players land on spaces that allow them to pick one, two or three puzzle pieces. They must take face-down pieces and try to match them to their puzzle. If they match, the may be added to the puzzle. If not, they are returned to the face-down pile. Some spaces also force players to put a puzzle piece back or stay on the space until a certain number is spun. The first player to complete his or her puzzle wins.

172136.name: Le Livre du Maître
172136.description:
This is a republication with permission of parts of Empire Galactique

From the original item:

This is a Space Opera RPG set in the 116th century. Players are members of a Empire who span across the entire galaxy. The background is quite light, for allow any type of SF adventure to take place.

This is, of course, a French "Traveller".

Translated from the website:

This is the game master handbook for Empire Galactique.
It contains rules the GM must know: action resolution, world creation, combat and wounds, verbal duels, psionics, trade, wear, tear and repairs. It doesn't contain any universe background.

172137.name: Les pirates de l'Amas de Gion
172137.description:
This is a republication with permission of parts of Empire Galactique

Translated from the website:

On the modest planet Kharg, a ground of pennyless aventurers room their misery. Until a malachite merchant hire them for a trivial mission that will lead them to the track of the infamous pirates of Gion.

This is the introductory adventure for Empire Galactique (2nd Edition).

172138.name: L'Asteroïde
172138.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Frontières de l'Empire as well as (currently missing in the Geek) an adventure book for the second edition.

Translated from the website:

In this short adventure, the PC will have, in order to get news from a friend, to explore an asteroid, full of surprises.

172139.name: Le cas de l'ambassadeur trop bien protégé
172139.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Frontières de l'Empire as well as (currently missing in the Geek) an adventure book for the second edition.

Translated from the website:

In this adventure the PCs are hired to sever as body guards for an imperial ambassador a tad paranoid.

Of course, this won't be event less.

This adventure is an investigation in a SF universe.

172140.name: La nuit des bourrins
172140.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Frontières de l'Empire as well as (currently missing in the Geek) an adventure book for the second edition.

Translated from the website:

Following their last adventures, the PCs have been sentenced to prison. Now they have to escape ; escape from the penitentiary planet Cerberus.

172141.name: Alpha-Bus
172141.description:
Alpha-Bus is an alphabet learning game for young children. The board is shaped like a bus and consists of an outer track of spaces marked with the letters of the alphabet in order. Inside the track are spaces where tiles with each of the letters printed on them are placed face-down. Each player rolls the die and moves their piece along the track. When they land on a letter, they choose a face-down tile of the same color. If the letter matches, they must say the name of the letter and then may roll again. If the letter does not match or they misidentify it, their turn is over. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

The board is two-sided. On one side, players must match upper-case with upper-case letters. On the other side, a more difficult match between lower-case and upper case is required.

172142.name: Le Dernier des Kandärs
172142.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Frontières de l'Empire

Translated from the website:

In this adventure, the PCs are crew member of a spaceship and receive, while in the empty void, a very curious message.
It will lead them to make contact with a very strand space station sheltering an still unknown civilisation, and live exciting aventures.

Sadly this was supposed to be only the first part of a campaign that never got published.

172143.name: Marine
172143.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Frontières de l'Empire

Translated from the website:

Marine is a world of pre-industrial technology mostly covered of oceans and belonging to the Twelve Suns Alliance, one of the various independant stats flourishing on the Empire out rim. Following the disappearance of two empire civil servant, as well as their first search party, the PCs are sent to investigate this double mystery before the Alliance authorities take over it.

172144.name: L'honneur des corsaires
172144.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1

Translated from the website:

Members of the Corsairs Brotherhood, the PCs have to help one of theirs that ran into trouble. A manhunt in deep space.

This adventure was designed to exercise the space fight rules published in the same book.

172145.name: Cas de Conscience
172145.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2

Translated from the website:
