The PCs are sent on a mission on a planet being evaluated by the Bureau of Indigenous Affairs. The have to explore it and report back to the Bureau. This report will decide of the future of the inhabitants...

Inspired by a short story written by Chad Oliver.

172146.name: Le Kerl de Mélancol
172146.description:
This is a republication with permission of an adventure from Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2

Translated from the website:

The supreme sage of the Empire just died. His last words were to name his successor. But already some faction are trying to prevent the succession to follow its pacific path. Who will be in charge of finding the designated successor before the other and bring him back to Prima? Obviously the PCs will be.

172147.name: The Ten Million Year FilmCow Wars Card Game
172147.description:
The Ten Million Year FilmCow Wars is a card game starring many of your favorite and least favorite FilmCow characters. It can be played by 2-4 people, and each game lasts around 15-30 minutes.

Can you score more points than your friends and/or bus stop acquaintances? I have no idea, maybe. I am not a mystical seer. The veil of time covers even my eyes."

The game is played by drawing s hand of cards and choosing one to play and one to discard. Each card falls into one of 5 color coded "suites". The first player to collect one of each suit wins the game. Each card features conditions such as requirements to play, or effects that happen once in play.

172148.description: Original Spin is whatever the equivalent of "vaporware" is. It doesn't exist. No one has seen an actual final copy.
172148.name: Original Spin

172150.name: X-Men
boardgamecompilation: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
172150.description:
Publisher's Description:

Be the first to get your X-Team to the X-Mansion! There's danger in the air! Juggernaut, that unstoppable engine of destruction, is roaming about the X-Mansion. Professor X's life is at risk. He telepathically calls his X-Men to the rescue. However, they are already on a mission to prevent Magneto from enrolling the Morlocks and their leader, Callisto, into his deadly plans. Help the X-Men stop the villains and restore safety to the X-Mansion.

X-Men was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is in the Pachisi/Sorry family. Each player has four markers. A roll of 4 is needed to get a marker on the start space. After that, they must enter a track and make their way around to their color of ladder They must then make their way up the ladder and roll the exact number to land on the X-Mansion. Along the way, if they land on another player's marker, they may either send it back to the start or take another turn. Spaces marked with villains move the marker backward or cause loss of a turn. The first player to land all four markers on the X-Mansion wins.

172151.name: Valiant Universe RPG Comic Book Play Guide
172151.description:
From the publishers webpage:

You and your friends are sitting around talking about comic books, ’cause that’s what we do, after all…

You’ve just finished reading Harbinger #21 and are wondering about Peter Stanchek’s powers. The key phrase that you’re excitedly debating is from Peter: “You know … it affects me pretty hard. Every time I scan someone. The homeless I wipe to keep rumors of your apparitions from spreading. All those Foundation members during Harada’s mind squall. Ax earlier today…”

One of you says, “Y’know, if I was Peter I’d simply anchor an invisibility shield to Monica Jim. Every time she leaves the Renegades’ underground lair, Peter’s psionic energy spikes on. That keeps Monica Jim hidden while alerting Peter to potential trouble while she’s out. But this also gives her some leash so the kid doesn’t go stir crazy.”

Another one of you says, “Nah, nothing in any of the comics says Peter can anchor his powers, much less have them kick off subconsciously like that. That’s going too far.”

And another friend pipes up and says, “Yeah, I agree. Not to mention that doesn’t solve Peter’s problem of the psychic weight he’s carrying. If I was Peter, I would’ve figured out how Harada’s mind squall worked while it was scrambling all that brain juice. The comics have shown how fast he adapts, after all. Then, when he’s scanning and erasing memories, he generates, well, let’s call it a ‘mind bubble.’ A subtle pressure of memories spread into a wide area—a pressure valve relief sorta thing. Kicks off déjà vu for anyone in a certain radius. But no one’s really hurt, no alarms sound, and Peter’s not getting crushed because he’s carrying the weight of everything.”

A chorus of “Oh … that’s good” flows around the room. Except for the original guy, who mutters, “I still like my idea better.”

Who hasn’t enjoyed those thought experiments as we’ve all put our imaginations to work in great debates to answer the questions that come out of reading the best comics? Well, that’s exactly what Valiant Universe: The Roleplaying Game lets you do.

This is your chance to step in, suit up, and answer those questions for yourself! How would you do it?

This comic provides another great example of how to roleplaying with your friends in the Valiant Universe.

172153.description:
A promo card for Seasons.

Type: Familiar
Prestige Points: 8
Invocation cost: 0 crystals

Continuous effect: Every opponent must from now on address you formally and call you «My Lord» until the end of the game. Each time an opponent neglects this rule, he loses 2 crystals.
172153.name: Seasons: Geek d'Argos

boardgameimplementation: A Song of Ice and Fief (fan expansion for Fief 1429)
172154.description:
The 5 expansions included in the Expansion Pack:

Tactical Expansion
Political Expansion
Crusaders Expansion
Templars Expansion
Teutonic Knights Expansion
172154.name: Fief: France 1429 – Expansions Pack

172155.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Where there were once six realms, now only a single remains: New Vigil. In Ascension: Dawn of Champions, you take on the role of your faction's Champion to guide them to victory in this world of new alliances and ancient foes.

New Champion cards let you play as a faction leader, building your reputation to unlock powerful cards and effects. This set also includes new multi-faction cards to acquire and defeat, including Constructs and Monsters!

As with all other Ascension sets, Ascension: Dawn of Champions can be played as a standalone game or combined with other Ascension games.
172155.name: Ascension: Dawn of Champions
boardgameexpansion: Ascension: Cetra, Benefactor of All Promo
Ascension: Dawn of Champions – Rys, Dark Muse Promo Card
Ascension: Dreamscape - Nova, Born of Chaos Promo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 1 - Our Introduction Into Gaming
Episode 193

172157.name: Farm Wars
172157.description:
Each player is a farmer living in the remote village of Farmaria. The aim of the game is to grow their farm and col-
lect as many Victory Points, (V.P.) as possible. On the Farm are a number of fields and commodities owned by each player. The V.P. represent the reputation of every player in Farmaria along with the quality of their farm. The game requires strategy along with commercial and business development aptitude.

This is a Strategy game for 2 to 5 players The players invest on their farms using an Action Choice Token System while at the same time the try to upgrade their property in an efficient way, stop other players from winning or interrupt their plans and avoid catastrophic events. The player with the most Victory Points wins the game.

172158.description:
A famous captain has arrived at the island with news of plunder and treasure. He seeks a few good men to add to his crew but will accept only members of the Brotherhood of Pirates. Rumor has it that he has amassed a huge fortune and is now looking for his replacement so that he can retire in a quiet plantation.

Oath of the Brotherhood is a strategic worker-placement game for 2 to 5 players. The players try to gather the necessary resources in order to fulfill their missions and gain the necessary victory points to win.
172158.name: Oath of the Brotherhood

172159.description: You are in charge of a stable of Knights that each have their own Knightly ability. Your Knights are going to the King's Jousting Tournament in order to joust against Knights from another House. You will roll dice to show your prowess and might. Use your influence gained during jousting to gain workers. You can increase the ability of your Knights with dice, cards, and powers!
172159.name: King's Champion
boardgamepodcastepisode: King's Champion
Mechanics in a Name

172160.name: Bride of Bloody Hooks
172160.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bride of Bloody Hooks, the follow up to BFG's popular Bloody Hooks, is the collection of adventure hooks that lives to kill again! The ideas in this ebook are designed to inspire new scenarios for your horror roleplaying game. Each entry is short, usually no more than a paragraph, containing only the strange premise, the hook, that will give rise to shudders and screams from your victims, er, players.

Bride of Bloody Hooks contains twenty two adventure hooks as well as sidebars offering devilish details, grisly finds, and strange rumors to add some chills to any horror roleplaying session.

172161.name: Eleusis Express
172161.description:
A simplification of Eleusis, an inductive reasoning card game, designed for classroom use.

The dealer chooses a secret rule. Players attempt to identify the rule by playing a card in turn, and the dealer identifies whether the card matches the rule or not.

According to Robert Abbott, designer of Eleusis, "[t]he chief feature of Eleusis Express is that if you figure out the rule, you simply say what it is. The dealer then says whether you are right or not, and if you’re right, you score extra points and the hand ends."

172162.description:
Buying ingredients, greeting guests, serving tables — running a restaurant can be hectic, and in the end only the one who is "Da Luigi" can keep an overview of everything and earn a star for the restaurant. If only you didn't have to deal with the other players who always act as unwelcome guests...

Your goal in Da Luigi is to get as many guests as possible, although only satisfied customers will always be good customers. Variety in the gameplay comes from the 90 individual guest cards, with you always wanting to find a free table for wealthy guests with plenty of time while pushing off grumpy customers in a hurry to your opponents.

Players buy ingredients for their meals from the market and pay for them in time — and time is always against you because if you don't serve a guest his desired food quickly, say, by the end of the game, you'll lose points in the end.
172162.name: Da Luigi
boardgamepodcastepisode: Da Luigi (Kosmos): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 262

boardgamecompilation: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
172163.description:
Publisher's Description:
Defeat Sabretooth! One evening, while Jubilee thinks she is alone in the X-Mansion, she hears strange noises coming from the surrounding woods. She sets out alone to investigate, even though she knows it might be dangerous. Fortunately for here, Wolverine is secretly keeping an eye on her. Sabretooth's scent is in the air. . .

Wolverine was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a roll-and-move game where players use two tokens, representing Wolverine and Jubilee, along a track. Each player in turn "rolls" the electronic die and moves one or the other token along the track, following any instructions on the space where they land. Spaces may move players forward or back or cause them to lose or gain a turn. Since players have two tokens, a small element of strategy is introduced in deciding which token is more advantageous to move with each roll. First player to reach the finish with both tokens wins.
172163.name: Wolverine

172164.description:
Knätsel?!, a reworking of the 1988 Spiel des Jahres-winning Barbarossa, challenges players to create and decipher "knätsels", i.e., kneading puzzles. (In the U.S., this game bears the title Dohdles!, a portmanteau of "dough doodles".)

In the game players use clay to create objects — a mountain, an animal, a famous ruin — then they take turns asking one another questions about these objects or asking for a letter in the name of this object. Everyone hears these requests, though, so your efforts might lead opponents to the correct answer, too, and since anyone can throw their solution stones into the answer funnel at any time, you'll need to think fast.

If you give the correct answer for a puzzle, both the creator and guesser score points — but if everyone guesses the answer, or conversely no one does, then the creator scores nothing. Who will find the ideal mix?
172164.name: Dohdles!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 63- Imperial Assault & Alternate Holiday Buying Guide
GenCon 2015 - Thames & Kosmos
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016

172165.name: The Hunger Games Presents: Tribute Trials
172165.description:
User Summary
The Hunger Games Presents: Tribute Trials is a puzzle game published online on the official Hunger Games/Scholastic website. In the game you selects a sequence of eight multiple-choice questions from a variety of scenarios from the Hunger Games. To win you must provide a correct series of answers to ensure you survive.

172166.name: Lumis: Der Pfad des Feuers
172166.description:
Whether as a team game for four players or a duel for two, players in Lumis: Der Pfad des Feuers must create a path of glowing fire stones that connect to their tower blocks on the game board.

Lumis is an abstract connection game in the tradition of classics like Hex and Twixt with each player (or team) trying to create a path from one side of the game board to its opposite side, but with the opposition working at cross purposes. To start the game, each side places tower blocks on the game board, then tries to build connections between these tower blocks using cards that match the colored spaces on the board. Once you have connected to a tower block, it's yours, but until you do so, the opponent can steal it from you.

The first player or team to make a complete connection wins!

172167.name: The Avengers
boardgamecompilation: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
172167.description:
Publisher's Description:

Race to Florida! The United States is on RED ALERT! Red Skull is threatening to spread his infamous dust of death all over the country. All the states, except Alaska and Hawaii, are at risk. It's up to you, the Avengers and Force Works, to get to Florida as quickly as you can and put an end to Red Skull's deadly plan. Remember, Kang and his temporal duplicates are out there to prevent you from accomplishing your mission!

The Avengers was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a roll-and-move game where players must move four markers (one at a time) in a numbered sequence from state to state on a map of the United States, starting in Washington and ending in Florida. Some states contain instruction to move forward or back or lose or gain a turn. If a player lands on a state occupied by another player's token, they must move back five spaces. First player to reach Florida with all five tokens wins.

172168.description:
Deep in the jungle lies the unexplored temple of the Mayan god Tschakka Lakka. Exploring together with Raccoon Jones, the players will try to uncover the precious treasures of the temple — but the loot comes closer only when you roll the matching temple symbols on the dice.

Will you be able to salvage the treasures in Tschakka Lakka: Die rasante Würfeljagd nach dem Tempelschatz? Will you be a lucky explorer and make it out in time with the temple's precious relics?
172168.name: Tschakka Lakka: Die rasante Würfeljagd nach dem Tempelschatz

172170.description:
The first expansion for the Conan board game: The Tower of Khitai, by multiple game award winning Antoine Bauza and Ludovic Maublanc. Take Conan and his companions East, to the mysterious land that is home to great sorcerers whose spells are feared by those from the West, and become swept up in a sinister assassination plot!
The box includes 22 highly detailed miniatures, two maps as well as host of cards/tokens and tiles. All this will allow you to play out a total of six scenarios (4 in the box, 2 on our website). The four scenarios in the box are magnificently crafted by the highly acclaimed authors Antoine Bauza (7wonders, Takenoko) and Ludovic Maublanc (Ca$h n’ Gun$, Cyclades). Take part in a daring assassination attempt before escaping from a flaming tower where the only way out is up!
172170.name: Conan: The Tower of Khitai

172171.name: The Incredible Hulk
boardgamecompilation: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
172171.description:
Publisher's Description:

Lure Absorbing Man to the Water! Absorbing Man has decided to eliminate the Incredible Hulk. He has set up a trap for the Hulk in a hydro power plant. You must join forces with She-Hulk and the Hulk to get rid of Absorbing Man, once and for all. Here's the plan. Since Absorbing Man can absorb the properties of anything he touches, She-Hulk and the Hulk will attempt to make Absorbing Man turn himself into fire. Then they will throw him into the sea, where he will disappear forever!

The Incredible Hulk was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a fairly standard roll-and-move game where players must move two tokens representing Hulk and She-Hulk one at at time along a track by rolling an electronic die. Along the way, some spaces will move players forward or back or cause a loss or gain of a turn. If a player lands on another player's token, he or she moves back four spaces. First player to reach the end with both markers wins.

172172.name: Highland Game
172172.description:
Object of the game is to be the first to get 1 figure to the opposite end of the board.

One player controls 4 miniatures, the other player controls 1.

The single figure can move forwards, backwards, sideways but not diagonally. And only 1 space at a time. The opposing player can only move forwards, one piece at a time. No jumping and no capturing.

The winner is the first to reach the opposite site end.

172173.name: Multiple Tic Tac Toe
172173.description:
OBJECT:
To win the majority of 9 games played simultaneously.

INCLUDES:
54 pegs
9 up gameboard
Instructions with box

(source: Text on box)

172174.name: Inquisitor Feats
172174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inquisitor Feats brings you 10 mythic feats for the most suspicious and paranoid class in Pathfinder, but that's only because everyone really IS out to get you. These feats let you get them first, enhancing your sense of right and wrong with feats like Insightful Gaze and Thoughtful Discernment alongside your powers to purge and purify the wicked with feats like Extended Bane, Improved Monster Lore, and Judgment Surge!

172175.name: Mineral Quiz
172175.description: An educational card game based around asking each other questions on a variety of rocks and minerals. There are a total of 400 questions on 40 different cards. Simple game that is easy to pick up.

172176.name: "B" is for "Battles"
172176.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Battle is Joined!

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at battles and large-scale conflicts, including:

Forces and their abilities
Battle and Morale tests
Qualities in battle
Characters in battle
Loses and collateral damage

172177.name: The Hunger Games: Trial By Fire
172177.description:
User Summary
The Hunger Games: Trial By Fire is a very short graphical text adventure game available to play on the official Hunger Games/Scholastic website. The game presents itself as a simulation of the Hunger Games designed to help prepare contestants. At each stage of the game players are given a description of a scenario and a choice between two courses of action. Making a poor choice will result in a swift death.

The game was launched to celebrate the publication of Catching Fire, the sequel novel to The Hunger Games.

172178.name: The Theosophyst (New Alternate Class)
172178.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new hybrid character class, the Theosophyyst. The Theosophyst couples the power of the cleric and wizard, allowing him to select both divine and arcane spells.

172179.name: Modular Jump Freighter
172179.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is an unarmed 300 dT jump capable freighter.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

172180.name: Entanglements: A Story Mapping Tool for RPGs
172180.description:
From publisher blurb:

Entanglements is a story-mapping tool for use with most any role-playing game. Over the course of a few hours you will build up a complex relationship map that can enrich and inform a campaign. The PDF includes a reference sheet and tips for using Entanglements with D&D, Fate, Fudge, GURPS, Apocalypse World, and more.

172181.name: Forgotten Tomb (3.5)
172181.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you’re still into edition 3.5 of the world's most popular role playing game we have a version of our free introduction title Forgotten Tomb for you too! This short adventure is great played as a stand-alone encounter or they dropped into an existing campaign. We’ve included a few monsters, traps and treasure to get your new characters started. The adventure also includes a map that can be used to set up your own player grid.

172182.name: Adventure Shorts
172182.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you’re still into edition 3.5 of the world's most popular role playing game we have a version of our first volume of adventure shorts for you too! These short adventures are great played as a stand-alone adventure or they dropped into an existing campaign. Each adventure includes a few monsters, traps, obstacles and treasure to get your new characters started. Each adventure also includes a map that can be used to set up your own player grid. The adventure titles are as follows:

Forgotten Tomb
Ambush
Abandoned Mine
Old Cottage
Black Tower

172183.name: Marketplaces A-C
172183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Herein we provide 3 new shop locations that can be used in any fantasy setting. Each is distinctive and different from a standard shop. They also include several adventure ideas and a table inspired by the location. This article showcases a fighting school, an inn and a masonry shop. These are good for several nights of adventure or as an interesting location the characters are passing through.

172184.name: Marketplaces D-F
172184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Herein we provide 3 new shop locations that can be used in any fantasy setting. Each is distinctive and different from a standard shop. They also include several adventure ideas and a table inspired by the location. This article showcases a general goods store, a shop that sells household elementals and a cobbler. These are good for several nights of adventure or as an interesting location the characters are passing through.

172185.name: Marketplaces G-I
172185.description:
From publisher blurb:

Herein we provide 3 new shop locations that can be used in any fantasy setting. Each is distinctive and different from a standard shop. They also include several adventure ideas and a table inspired by the location. This article showcases a fortune teller, a placement service for servants and an inn hiding a sinister secret. These are good for several nights of adventure or as an interesting location the characters are passing through.

172186.name: Marketplace
172186.description:
From publisher blurb:

26 unique shops for any fantasy setting.

This system agnostic product gives you a wide variety of interesting and adventure generating shops that you can use to populate any town. They can be used as sources of adventure or as an interesting location the characters pass through.

Each shop is given an overview that gives it a hook that makes the shop different from similar shops. Personalities are given for the imporant NPCs of each shop. Adventure Ideas are provided that can provide many evenings of exciting fun.

Marketplace provides new and interesting locations that will keep your players guessing.

172187.name: Goldmarsh Village
172187.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here is a complete village (Goldmarsh) for the party to explore and interact with. The village is completely system-free and can provide many adventures just from the descriptions therein. The village has 23 locations and 50 individuals. There are 13 adventure ideas along with rumors. This village can serve as a central location for a campaign or as an interesting place for your player characters to pass through. It also is excellent if you need a quick village on the fly.

Please note, if you have already bought our other product, Adventure at Goldmarsh, you already have this product.

172188.name: Adventure at Goldmarsh
172188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure At Goldmarsh provides you with two resources.

First is the adventure itself (Adventure at Goldmarsh), one wherein the party must stop another band of adventurers from waking an ancient power. This adventure starts with an investigation followed by a trip through a marsh, an exploration of a ruin and culminates in a battle in the past.

The second is a complete village (Goldmarsh) for the party to explore and interact with. The village is completely system-free and can provide many adventures just from the descriptions therein.

Simple stats are provided for OSR retroclone type systems, and as such, this module works best for characters around 5th level. However, it is very easy to import stats from your favorite game system and run it at any level.

172189.name: Infected Zombie (ICONS)
172189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Infected Zombie Hordes to Your ICONS Game

Is your ICONS game missing the infected zombie hordes you've always dreamed of?

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters for ICONS provides game stats on the Infected Zombie, a creature returned from the dead to eat brains and spread its infection to the living.

Includes the infected zombie template so you can transform any creature into an infected member of the undead, along with example infected zombie bystander and infected dog stat blocks. There is also a special infected lasher zombie template (zombies that whip and entangle their prey using their own intestines), infected blob zombie template (zombies that spew bile and rotting flesh to attract other zombies), and infected stalker zombie template (zombies that leap large distances to pounce upon their prey), each with a zombie bystander example.

There is also the intelligent infected zombie template for portraying characters who are overcome by the zombie infection but retain their intelligence, along with an infected intelligent super-hero zombie example.

Rounding out this product are eight plot ideas for using infected zombies in your game, and suggestions on how the zombie infection may function in your game.

172190.name: The Grand Mêlée (HERO)
172190.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the middle ages there was little to no organized sport as we know it. Oh, there were sports and games aplenty, and any time traveler could go back and find the distant (or not so distant) ancestors of such modern games as field hockey, football (i.e. soccer), lawn bowling, and even baseball. But there were no regulated sports with one exception. This was the tournament, a martial sport performed by the nobility, of the nobility, and for the nobility. Tournaments were often planned well in advance (up to a year or more), featured a great deal of pomp and spectacle, and often had carefully spelled out rules for what would be (and would not be) allowed. Best of all, a tournament might last for a week or even longer, and would bring a great influx of people and money to whatever town was lucky enough to have one held nearby. Thus, a medieval tourney makes for an excellent Fantasy Hero scenario, and can feature all the action and adventure a GM and his players may wish for -- even if no one is actually fighting in the tournament itself!

The latest addition to the Surbrook's Stuff product line will jousting with the best of them.

172192.name: Pinball Planet
172192.description:
Pinball Planet is a mobile game for Android, iOS and Windows Phone. The game includes three completely different and unique pinball levels full of mysteries and secrets. A dynamic mission system unlocks new challenges and fun approaches to pinball gameplay. Pinball Planet features simple RPG elements such as a leveling system, power-ups, statistics, a simple in-game economy, challenges and complete freedom in gameplay progression.

It's a game for everyone, gamers both old and new to pinball. It combines the best parts of old-school pinball games, but adds original and fun digital additions that are not possible in real-life pinball games. The game is easy to understand and play. It's perfect for short play sessions and stays challenging during long play sessions thanks to the fun mission system.

Key Features
• Unique and exciting pinball levels
• Accessible and casual gameplay
• Full real-time 3D visuals
• Freedom in gameplay progression
• Dynamic challenge system
• Leveling and statistics
• Fun powerups to experiment with
• Dynamic challenge system

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamecompilation: Spyfall: The Box Is Not Enough
172193.description: This promo pack adds seven Ice Hockey Stadium location cards and one Spy card.
172193.name: Spyfall: Ice Hockey Stadium promo cards

172194.name: Age of Nobles
172194.description:
User summary:

The players are lord of house during Victorian England, and must, during six rounds, build up noble fame by having a staff of maids, important connections and land strips.

Each round, a number of cards (maids, noble connections and lands) are laid out, and each player has 2 pawns that he may use to claim cards. Knocking away another player from a card costs money that goes into the treasury; and the treasury can also be claimed. Lands cost money to claim, but brings an income each round.

The 3rd and the 6th round there is a scoring round, in which players get points for maids, combinations thereof, noble connections and land. The player with the most points at the end wins.

172195.name: Top Gear: Extreme Parking
172195.description:
User Summary
An action/car racing game based on the BBC TV series 'Top Gear'. The game features the Top Gear Test Track and vehicles from the show. Game modes are: Precision Driving (drive without crashing), Chase The Stig (racing), and Total Destruction (gain points by demolishing the TV set and other locations from the show).

172196.name: Top Gear: Race The Stig
172196.description:
Can you tame our tame racing driver in our FREE new game for mobile? You can now pit your wits against The Stig on your favoured mobile device.

The game itself is a high-speed journey through some of the most iconic Top Gear locations, where you'll use your skills to collect as many Golden Nuts as possible whilst jumping, ducking and dodging around obstacles and other vehicles.

It wouldn't be Top Gear without the cars, of course. Race The Stig allows players to drive some of the series' most recognisable challenge vehicles including Richard Hammond's beloved Oliver, Jeremy's Italian police car complete with Ben Hur wheels, and James' Amphibious Triumph Herald. And the infamous Indestructible Pickup-truck features as the ultimate shield against destruction . All the while, players will be chased and blocked by His Stigness...

Source: The Developer Website.

172197.name: Top Gear: Amphibious Challenge
172197.description:
Choose between Jeremy’s Toybota, Richard's Damper Van or that Herald sailing boat thing James manage to sink within seconds, then try to float your way to France. It’s as simple as that… isn't it?

Source: The Developer Website.


User Summary
An action/balance game where you attempt to keep your vehicle afloat by mousing left and right to counter the roll. If you lose control, you sink.

172198.description:
Tigers in the Mud - Eastern Front Stand at the Panther Line: An all new take on the classic Ostfront battle with remastered, ENLARGED MAP that makes this a one-of a kind experience with armor, armor and did we mention armor? By early 1944, Army Group North held a front that bore the marks of previous battles; a long line built around Leningrad. Of course, STAVKA’s Baltic Front planners were determined to break the hold and finally free the city. 1943 ended with Army Group North facing the Russian Third Shock Army. Fighting had continued unabated through a muddy fall, and on into the month of December. Although the Germans had successfully held their front, the fighting power of Armee Gruppe Nord had been greatly reduced. The dead and wounded landsers were replaced by Latvian, Estonian, and Spanish soldiers. When OKW pulled the 5th Mountain Division out of the line, without a replacement, the time had come for a shortening of the front. The result became known as the ‘Panther Line’.
Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

You also need to own the following to play:

Russian Personnel 2014 Edition
German Personnel 2014 Edition
ATS Russian AFVs and H Weapons - 2014D
ATS German AFVs and H Weapons 2014D
172198.name: ATS Core Module: Sujewo Heights – Tigers in the Mud 1944

172200.description:
In the year 4010, humankind has ships in space but no colonies. Earth explodes and the last of our kind must set aside their differences and team up to tame a wild world and save humanity before time runs out! In this action packed cooperative strategy game, players will captain their starships as humankind’s Last Starfleet! Everyone wins in Last Starfleet… or all is lost.

Each ship has its own deck of cards which players will use to upgrade their ships, guard against planet attacks and land their crew in order to win the game! Each planet will pose unique challenges to the team and landing your people is never an easy task.

Things We'll Add to Deluxe Copies:
Ship Expansion - Galactic Command, Pangaea government
Ship Expansion - Pay Dirt, orbital extraction and mining station
Ship Expansion - Eagle Eye, the lost cosmonauts
Planet Expansion - Cryton, the siege of Cryton
Planet Expansion - Kurmaraja, the sleeping giant
Planet Expansion - Terra Nine, the jungle of madness
Planet Expansion - Derelict One, tragic site of the first use of a dark matter core
Orbit Deck Expansion - Asteroid Belt, great and treacherous orbital rings
172200.name: Last Starfleet (Deluxe edition)

172201.description:
On the Road to Rome 1944: SANTA MARIA INFANTE: A brand new take on the struggle along the ridge ... along the road to Rome. The Germans are dug in, the Americans well-armed ... the outcome is in YOUR hands. The battle for Santa Maria Infante was important in the opening of the Allied offensive toward Rome on 11 May 1944. Strong Allied forces were concentrated on the west side of the Italian peninsula to renew an effort stopped by the winter and heavy German resistance. Eighth Army was poised for attack through the Liri Valley along the axis of Highway No. 6; main Fifth Army faced a chain of mountains, in a 13-mile zone from the Liri River to the sea. The forces in the Anzio Beachhead were ready to strike when their opportunity came as a result of progress on the other fronts.

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

You also need to own the following to play:

American Personnel 2014 Edition
German Personnel 2014 Edition
ATS U.S. AFVs and H Weapons - 2014D
ATS German AFVs and H Weapons 2014D
172201.name: ATS Core Module: On the Road to Rome – Gothic Line 1944

172203.description:
Imagine an intricately mechanized clash of spy against spy, introducing corporate espionage to a Steampunk world of industrial revolution; filled with all of the plot twists and thrills of both genres. That's the world of Steam Spy, a Steampunk themed role playing card game for 2 players. Steam Spy unites the character development and narrative of a traditional role playing game with the intimacy and spontaneity of a card game.

Players create a unique secret agent character who works for one of the organizations designated to protect and serve one of the world’s largest corporations. Then they face off against an operative from an opposing secret industrial organization in a one on one battle of wits, luck and exotic steampunk gadgets. One player instigates some kind of espionage mission while the other does their best to stop them.

Players collect, play and draw cards that help create a series of exciting encounters that ultimately determine if the instigating antagonists succeeds at their mission, or the determined protagonist chases them down and defeats them; players then advance their spy character, or create a group of secret agent specialists in preparation for the next face off against operatives from opposing agencies and corporation.

Steam Spy: Shadows and Circuits allows you to investigate the mysterious as an agent of the Shadow Bureau, the Eastern European agency that helps protect the lines of transportation developed by the Transylvanian Transportation Company. Or you can join the Dragon Sect and take advantage of the marvelous technology developed by its parent company Orisaku Artificials.
172203.name: Steam Spy: Shadows and Circuits

172204.name: Nova Cry: Dark Suns
172204.description:
Dark Suns, expansion of the sci-fi card game Nova Cry, presents 30 new cards including 2 ships, 2 new captains, 1 new crew member type, new alien crew members, and action cards

Nova Cry is an explosive sci-fi adventure for 2-6 players. Loaded with customizable options, each player chooses 1 ship, 1 captain, 3 crew members and 1 personal weapon as they set out into the danger-filled spaces of Gallator Seven. Will you explore creature-infested planets? Race an opponent to an undiscovered planet? Challenge another captain to a duel? Blast your opponent’s ship to smithereens? It’s all up to as you carve out a strategic path to victory in this remarkable world of heroes, villains, and awe-inspiring spaceships.

The first player to score 15 victory points or be the last undestroyed ship wins.

Players score points by reaching planets, winning duels, and performing actions using their available crew members (skilled in Exploration, Alien Technology, Medicine, Psychology, Repair, and Ship Upgrades). Players also collect Intel points to initiate ship battles and character duels, and will have to choose from 1 of 4 strategies during their turn to plan their victory!

172206.description:
In the XVI century Italy was the scene of wars and dynastic quarrels. In the Papal States, Pope Paul III knew he could rely on the strength of the powerful Orsini family to oppose the power of his enemies. In 1542 Pierfrancesco II Orsini, called Vicino, inherited the fief of Bomarzo, which elected to his residence, along with the fiefs of Collepiccolo, Castelvecchio, Montenero and Mompeo. In 1547 Vicino Orsini wanted to celebrate the grandeur of his family, by commissioning one of the greatest architectural wonders of Italy. Within a natural amphitheater were masterfully carved huge mythological figures, whose sublime beauty enchants and terrifies those who are in their presence. Even today the park is shrouded in mystery: is it a Sacred Grove in which to bring votive offerings to the gods or a Park of Monsters made to scare poor people? It's rumored that Vicino Orsini owed his own fortune to the devotion shown to the gods and to the offers that he brought to them.

In Bomarzo, you will have to delve into the mystery of the park, to propitiate the gods and obtain their favor. You’ll play the role of one of the feudal lords of the Orsini and you’ll manage one of four minor feuds, Collepiccolo, Castelvecchio, Montenero or Mompeo, trying to earn the esteem of your lord. If you’ll develop your feud in the best way you will manage to prevail over your rivals. Do not forget the supernatural forces that dwell in Bomarzo: your existence and your achievement will be influenced by how you manage to turn in your advantage the will of the monsters of the park.

Bomarzo is a game of deep strategy for 2-4 players, the short duration of which gives to the players' choices even more decisive importance. The careful management of resources will allow you to easily take advantage of the power of the monstrous deity of the park. Each turn you will be able to perform various operations in your fief and also you will have to choose which god ingratiate, through workers placement bound by auction. But beware: each divinity of the park requires a very specific offer to concede his favor otherwise unleash his monstrous fury on unwary visitors! To triumph in Bomarzo you not only need the best development but mostly to have tied your for-tunes to the most powerful and prestigious deity.
172206.name: Bomarzo
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 51 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 3

172207.description:
Unspeakable Words is the Call of Cthulhu Word Game designed by James Ernest and Mike Selinker. In the game, you and your opponents will attempt to form words from the letter cards in your hand. Each letter is worth points – the amount of points is determined by the number of angles in the letter (where the hounds of Tindalos are lurking!). You may try to make the highest scoring word possible, but… you’ll have to test the strength of the word against a roll of the 20-sided die. Roll equal to or higher than the value of your word and you’re safe… but roll less than the value of your word and you lose a precious piece of your sanity, represented by an adorable Cthulhu pawn!

Each letter is uniquely illustrated with a horrifying character from the works of H.P. Lovecraft, which adds to the dark whimsy of the game.

Since its release in 2007, Unspeakable Words has been received with great reviews. It was Games Magazine's Word Game of the Year and the Best Party Board Game at BoardGameGeek's Golden Geek Awards. In 2008, a second edition of Unspeakable Words was released, this time with purple pawns. Because of the flexibility of the game, a second deck and second set of pawns can be added for twice as many players.

Since the inception of Unspeakable Words, Playroom Entertainment has wanted to release more specialized editions. With this Kickstarter, supporters can upgrade the Unspeakable Words game with special multi-colored pawns (five pawns each of eight colors to play up to eight players!), a dice/pawn bag and additional cards! AND...this Deluxe Edition will feature artwork by famed artist John Kovalic! Plus, if we hit our stretch goals, even more amazing things will be added to the game!
172207.name: Unspeakable Words (Deluxe Edition)
boardgameexpansion: Unspeakable Words: "K is for Exploding Kithulhu" Promo Card

172208.name: The World of Shotguns & Sorcery
172208.description:
From the Introduction:

Noir sensibilities and firearms technology meet epic fantasy in the Shotguns & Sorcery novels and stories. This setting chapter allows you to visit that world as a hero of your own design. Also be sure to check out the full Shotguns & Sorcery roleplaying game from Outland Entertainment.

172209.name: Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching: Exclusive Kickstarter Pack
172209.description:
Kickstarter backers received the following promo cards, which could also be purchased separately during the Kickstarter:

Group of three survivors
Serum Z9Y
Serum Z4Y
Timed high explosive
The Zombie Hunter
Zombie Overlord




They also received 26 card stands so that the Zombies will be 3-D when they walk around the board.

172210.name: Kill the Commie Bastards! (2nd Edition)
172210.description:
user summary

The 2nd Edition of the game includes:


A 16-page rulebook.
A 6-page supplement titled Kill the Commie Mutant, Alien Bastards! In 3-D!. The primarily contains additional character "stats" such as nationality, hair part, drink of choice, tobacco of choice, etc. It also has additional equipment and "scenarios" featuring aliens.
A sheet of cardstock stand-up figures representing characters.
A sheet of cardstock counters representing opponents.

172211.name: Europa Universalis IV: El Dorado
172211.description:
El Dorado is the fifth expansion to Europa Universalis IV and brings to life the conquests, creeds and discoveries synonymous with the Age of Exploration. The centerpiece of the latest addition is the Nation Designer, which allows the customization of a starting nation in a campaign and further enhances EU4’s already near infinite replayability. This expansion’s focus on Central America and South America introduces new religions whilst impactful theaters of exploration will challenge you with new decisions worthy of a king or conqueror. As the Aztecs, subject the Mexican plain to your rule but be sure to have enough vassal kings to sacrifice to your angry gods. As the Europeans, push deeper into the jungles of the Amazon, following rumors of lost cities and magical fountains.

Whatever path you choose, El Dorado is sure to be a golden addition to your Europa Universalis IV playing experience.

Main features:

A deep Nation Designer gives you new starting options for your games, including national ideas and custom monarchs.
Experience the new Nahuatl, Inti and Mayan religions with blood sacrifices or Sun Worship.
Send your conquistadors to hunt for the Seven Cities of Gold, or your explorer on exploration missions around the world.
Gold Fleets can traffic New World wealth back to Europe, and be targeted by your privateer fleets.
Use your trade fleets to hunt dangerous pirates.
Maintain good relations with the Pope so you can get a corner of the world to call your own in the Treaty of Tordesillas.




Source: The Publisher Website.

172212.name: Wights (Pathfinder)
172212.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter the realm of the night as you take on the wight.

The evil of the wight reawakens in this supplement with quick rules on how to play wights if your game master is so daring with a quick wight template and a new race: the dreaded Half-Wight. A half undead creature that people tend to stay away from.

Inside are 10 new wights from the Dire Wight, the Energy Wight and the horrid Harbinger Wight.

But that's not all, inclused with each is a basic character class so that you can play each individual wight with unique rules for each.

You'll also find 25 feats, 19 new spells and 3 new wight gods each with their own planar descriptions for places to take your players to explore.

Face the might of the wight and see if you come out ... alive or otherwise.

172213.name: Protean Lords of Porphyra
172213.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here comes the Slithering Symphony.

While the zendiqi worshiped the Elemental Lords and the elves and orcs longed for Gods to save them, the erkunae reached out to the frickle protean lords in times of trouble.

Within this tome you will find information on:

The twelve protean lords worshipped by the erkunae and other non-deist chaotic factions of Porphyra written up in the Gods of Porphyra format.
Symbols for each of the protean lords.
11 new magic items created by the followers of the Protean Lords
3 new subdomains of Intuition, Mayhem, and Wild Magic
12 new spells favored by the followers of the Protean Lords




This serves as a companion piece to the Gods of Porphyra and Elemental Lords of Porphyra and further expands the mythology of the Porphyra setting.

As with Gods of Porphyra, Protean Lords are released as 100% open game content.

A perfect choice for someone needing more chaotic proteans in their campaign.

172214.name: Werelion
172214.description:
From publisher blurb:


Proud and Deadly Lords!

Were they men who became lions, or lions who became men? Were they divinely awakened beasts? Druids who abandoned civilization to live the thrill of the hunt?

No one knows for certain—and the werelions themselves don’t particularly care.

These powerful warriors and canny hunters prowl the warm grasslands and snow-capped mountains, content in the superiority of their way of life.

Advanced Races: Werelions is your essential guide to this proud race of lycanthropes that roams the Southlands. This 14-page PDF by designers Brian Suskind and Ben McFarland includes:

Racial traits for both natural and afflicted werelion PCs
2 new racial archetypes: Lion-Blooded (Sorcerer) and the Hunting Lion (Inquisitor)
8 werelion racial feats, including Bestial Roar, Detect Shapeshifter and Flawless Adaptation
5 race-specific traits including Desert Wanderer, Fetish Hunter and Mountain Stalker
New spells and magic items
And more!




Remind the world who truly rules the Southlands—get Advanced Races: Werelion today!

172216.name: #Harshmode Monday (#11 - Jan 19, 2015)
172216.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

172217.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 49 - Jan 20, 2015)
172217.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #49: Unique Superscience Artifacts V

With amazing powers, terrible mutants, and scientific advancements available only in our collective imagination, Mutant Future stretches the bounds of conception. From a foundation of Clarke’s Second Law and Goblinoid Games’ supplement Realms of Crawling Chaos, we present superscience artifacts, devices that are one step beyond and seemingly magical even to characters familiar with wondrously advanced technology. This issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands coalesces around the mind-bending, with artifacts ranging from hazardous personal-improvement gear and pet accoutrements to a many-pedal building and diabolical nightmare toys for both kids and adults.

These items are intended for Mutant Future games but could easily fit into other science-fiction or fantasy games with little or no adjustment. Each artifact is so detailed every one could become a central plot point or continuing idea for whole gaming sessions — or entire campaigns. They are not one sentence, throw-away items: each has a history that will hopefully enrich, inspire, possibly even drive your own gaming story, and we hope you enjoy them.

172218.name: Imagination: Party
172218.description:
Do you think that you can explain in a minute what an old chestnut or a permafrost is? Will you be able to do it while standing on one leg or by using verbs only?

Воображарий: Вечеринка (Imagination: Party) is a fun game about guessing words based on the hit Russian game Воображарий. Each turn, a player is selected to describe a word or a short phrase. A special card dictates whether the player have to give an explanation, to act or to do a unique show! If you are active, creative and positive you'll get a chance to become the brightest star of your party!

Imagination: Party is a standalone game, but it can also be combined with Imagination.

172219.description:
The ASL Winter Offensive 2015 Bonus Pack features three Pete Shelling scenario designs and two redesigned boards. The new maps "freshen" certain older boards using overlays specifically designed for each board.

ASL Winter Offensive 2015 Bonus Pack contains:

2 ASL/ASLSK geomorphic standard mapboards, labeled 10z and 17z (to honor their heritage)
Scenarios:

WO15 - Liberation Day - 6 turns, board 17z and 10z, 27 January 1944 Oredezh, Russia

WO16 - Wildcat Strike - 6-1/2 turns, board 10z and 67, 17 September 1944 Saian Town, Angaur Island

WO17 - Poteau Party - 7 turns, boards 2b and 17z, 21 December 1944 Poteau, Belgium

Proceeds from the sales of each WO Bonus Pack 2015 are donated to the WWII Foundation.
172219.name: WO Bonus Pack #6: ASL Scenario Pack for Winter Offensive 2015

boardgameintegration: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
172220.description:
In the Dungeons & Dragons: Temple of Elemental Evil Board Game, you play as a heroic adventurer. With amazing abilities, spells and magic weapons, you must explore the dungeons beneath the Sword Coast where you will fight monsters, overcome hazards and find treasure. Are you ready for adventure?

Temple of Elemental Evil includes multiple scenarios, challenging quests, and co-operative game play designed for 1-5 players. The contents can also be combined with other D&D Adventure System Cooperative play board games, including The Legend of Drizzt and Castle Ravenloft.

Each player selects a hero, such as a fighter, cleric, or wizard. On their turn, each player can explore further into the dungeon (turn over new tiles), move through the already explored parts of the dungeon, and fight monsters. When a new dungeon tile is revealed, there is typically an encounter of some sort, and new monsters to fight are added. Slain monsters reward the players with treasure, and experience points, allowing them to level up and increase their skills during play. Players must cooperate to stay alive, slay the monsters, and achieve the goal of their quest. Each scenario has a different goal, from retrieving a relic to slaying a large boss monster.
172220.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Temple of Elemental Evil Board Game
boardgameexpansion: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Gray Hag Promo
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game – Vierna Do'Urden Promo
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Boardgame - Kobold Champion Promo
boardgamefamily: Dungeons and Dragons Adventure System Board Games
From RPG books to board games
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Section 28: Temple of Elemental Evil
The Game Pit - Episode 56 - The Bumper Review of 2015 (with Top 5s)

172221.description: Published in Command Magazine 22 (Antietam: Burnished Rows of Steel), Smithereens Variant is an expansion for Smithereens, with new rules for pro Axis Yugoslavians and Nazi secret weapons. Also add 12 new counters for play this expansion
172221.name: Smithereens Variant

172223.name: Gnome Man Is An Island
172223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the catalyst adventure scenario for the Tsunami Living Campaign. Gnome Man Is An Island is a low-level fantasy adventure scenario intended to be played in a single session, introducing plot elements and themes that will provide the underpinning for the living campaign primary storyline.

Play the role of one of a small group of heroes stranded on a tropical island occupied by power-mad gnomes with a mysterious vendetta. Be part of the campaign’s history and see how it all began…

172224.name: Ghost Blitz
172224.description:
User Summary

Ghost Blitz the app brings the famous boardgame to iOS and Android.
It is a reaction game that uses only two rules:

1. If the object appears colored correctly, you have to grab it before the other players.
2. If both object shown in the card are colored incorrectly you have to grab the missing object.

The app offers online multiplayer, hot seat and single player options.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
172225.description:
Exploding Kittens is a kitty-powered version of Russian Roulette. Players take turns drawing cards until someone draws an exploding kitten and loses the game. The deck is made up of cards that let you avoid exploding by peeking at cards before you draw, forcing your opponent to draw multiple cards, or shuffling the deck.

The game gets more and more intense with each card you draw because fewer cards left in the deck means a greater chance of drawing the kitten and exploding in a fiery ball of feline hyperbole.
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 204: What We Did On Our Summer Break
172225.name: Exploding Kittens
boardgamepodcastepisode: 003: Party time!
Blåt blod & rød-hvide farver
Episode 43 - Shadows Over Normandie
Episode 62- The Golden Ages and Angry Gaming
Exploding Kittens
Garrett's Games 480 - Meeplefest 2015, Night 2, Part 2
HLG 1: De Start
Strange Assembly 182 - Jay and the Hologram
Strange Assembly 184 - In With The Old, In With The New
Strange Assembly 202 - Underrated Games
Strange Assembly 205 - 2016 Wrap-Up
The Game Pit: Episode 64 - Automobiles and more….
The Good, The Board, and the Fluffy: Episode 32 “Light Games”
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 1: Specter Ops, Euphoria, Dead of Winter, Exploding Kittens
Vox Republica 070: Change Is Good

172227.description: Lords of Xidit: Bonus Titans Promo is a set of three new titans to mix into the titans from the Lords of Xidit base game, adding three more titans for you to fight!
172227.name: Lords of Xidit: Bonus Titans Promo

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
172228.name: The Palace Beyond
172228.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Palace Beyond is an OSRIC module designed for 4-6 adventurers of levels 6-9.

The Palace Beyond is ancient, and the race that built it is long gone. The palace exists on many levels of reality, and it is said it is everywhere and nowhere at once. It connects different parts of the world: it is possible to walk through a magic portal, into one of the palace’s corridors, turn around a corner, and then walk through another portal to end up in a far away land. But now the palace is deserted, and the magic that made it possible is slowly crumbling. Its pocket dimension is collapsing, and large sections of the palace have already fallen into Nothingness.

172229.name: Minister 8
172229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Minister 8 is a story roleplaying game about a fascist and religious, futuristic society ruled by the ministers — true executors of the law and defenders of the faith. Tasked with defending society from itself, the ministers are elite guardians of society, routing out every offense imaginable — from contraband to drug use; from larceny to murder; from organized crime to human trafficking; from religious heresy to sins against the state. Using the tenets of their religious faith as the backbone of the society’s civil structure, the ministers are part lawgivers and part religious authority. Characters take on the role of these elite members.

Specifically, they are members of the Janus Squad, a team of secret ministers who investigate other ministers suspected of malfeasance.

172232.name: Isengard y las Montañas Blancas
172232.description:
user summary

Spanish edition for two MERP sourcebooks:
Isengard and Northern Gondor
Dunland and the Southern Misty Mountains

172234.name: Beaumains (Issue 1 - 1992)
rpgissuearticle: The Adventure of the Fey Mist
The Adventure of the Moonlight Boar
The Adventure of the Twice-Trothed Knight

172235.description:
Schrödinger’s Cats is a pseudo-scientific card game of strategic uncertainty for 2-6 players. A fast, fun game of bluffing, deduction, and cute cat pictures!

Uncertainty didn’t kill the cat, but that doesn’t mean it’s not dead. Dr. Erwin Schrödinger and Werner Heisenberg taught us that. We’ve all heard about the cats in boxes experiment and maybe we're even curious about the results -- but attempting such an experiment would be INSANE in real life! Now you can try your hand at challenging the uncertainty principle without risking the lives of innocent kittens or exposure to radioactive particles! Awww!

In Schrödinger’s Cats players run experiments, form hypotheses, and try to one-up each other’s research. Players take on the role of a Cat Physicist such as Albert Felinestein, Sally Prride, or Neil deGrasse Tabby! Using their special ability to help prove their hypothesis, or at least debunk someone else’s, each cat physicist tries to determine the minimum number of alive cats, dead cats, or empty boxes across all the boxes in Schrödinger’s lab.

You may not be certain your hypothesis is valid, but if you love cats, science, and games you will be certain to love the Schrödinger's Cats card game!
172235.name: Schrödinger's Cats

172237.name: UNO Dare!
172237.description:
From the publisher's website:

The familiar fun race to yell "UNO!" comes with wild, new choices! While playing the color and numbers matching game, you're faced with a decision: draw extra cards or take a dare! Dare cards come in 3 categories: Family, Show-Off and Daredevil, with 16 dares on each card. You may end up talking like a pirate until your next turn, or standing on one foot, or even showing your best dance moves! There is even a blank card to make up your own dares! What will you risk - drawing more cards or doing something wild? Find out when you play this new version of the classic UNO game - if you DARE! And don't forget to yell "UNO!", even if you have to do it like a pirate, matey! Comes with instructions and 112 playing cards. Ages 7 and older.

172238.name: Beaumains (Issue 2 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: A Chronology of the Knights of King Arthur's Britain
Greg Stafford Speaks - an interview with Gareth Jones
The Early Adventures of Lancelot du Lac
172238.description:
Fanzine for Pendragon RPG 3rd Edition.
Paper cover.
Published in early to mid 1993.

172239.name: Metamorphosis Alpha Referee's Screen
172239.description:
(from publisher website)

This three-panel GM screen is everything you need to run a game using the 1976 edition of Metamorphosis Alpha!

172240.name: Beaumains (Issue 3 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Paganism, Christianity and the Arthurian Myth
The Adventure of the Blind Knight
The Adventure of the Mysterious Manor
The Knightly Order of St Eustace
The Quest for the Holy Mail
172240.description:
Fanzine for Pendragon RPG 3rd edition.
Paper cover.
Published in mid to late 1993.

172241.name: Adventure Anthology 1
172241.description:
From the back of the book

Adventures in Ysgarth
Eight visits to a fantastic world

Featuring Adventures by: Dave Nalle, Jan Mierik and Hans Dykstra

Lovers of the Grave - A lovestruck Necromancer attempts to pursue his desires beyond the gates of death.

The Gardens of Alferai Kantiss - Something is very wrong in Tolemeias' most popular park and something has to be done about it.

Ironfields - A visit to the iron-bearing bogs of the Kyveni hills in inner Ustradui.

Taking the Waters - Ailing characters take a trip to a healing spring to improve their health and perhaps their fortunes as well.

Welcome to the Obsidian Wombat - A night of adventure and danger in Tolemeias' most popular tavern.

A Death in Dockside - A sordid dip into the dark underside of life in the City of Tolemeias.

Chains of Blood - The Doomlords are threatening to break free of their prison. Only the greatest of sacrifices can save the world.

On the Road to Adventure - A collection of encounters and mini-adventure ideas for wayfarers in Ysgarth.

172242.description: Originally an expansion for Exploding Kittens, the most successful Kickstarer project ever, that contained cards that were too horrific and/or incredible to be included in a kid safe version. As a stretch goal this was turned into a stand alone game that can be combined with the standard Exploding Kittens deck.
172242.name: Exploding Kittens: NSFW Deck
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 009 – Top 10 Games of 2015
Episode 43 - Shadows Over Normandie
Exploding Kittens
GrogCast Season 3, Episode Cinco!

172244.name: Mars: Kolonizacja
172244.description:
Earth is long gone as the perfect place to live. As one of the architects sent to the red planet, you will be tasked with creating an infrastructure for those, who wish to start a new life.

Mars: Kolonizacja (Mars: Colonization) is a quick card game that gives you three different ways to activate each card: by playing from hand, activating one of the cards on the table or activating enemy's card. Keep in mind – Mars is not a place for gentlemen and your decisions often affect not just you, but other players as well!

To win the game, gather the largest number of colonists by developing newer and better buildings.

172245.name: World Invasion: Battle Los Angeles
172245.description:
User Summary:

"World Invasion: Battle Los Angeles" brings the action of the same named sci-fi movie right to your home. In this shooter you can experience the alien invasion by your own and it is in your hand to defeat the aliens.

172247.name: Music Monstars
172247.description:
User Summary:

"Music Monstars" let you feel like a rock star. Play special version of "Final Countdown" or "Personal Jesus" that were created for the game ether alone or found a band and play them with your friends on several Nintendo DS.

You can also create your own songs and prove your musical skills.

172248.name: The Big Bang Theory: Das geniale Spiel
172248.description:
Leonard, Howard and Raj want a killer robot; Penny, Bernadette and Amy a preserved snowflake; and Sheldon? How about a "device for virtual presence"?

The Big Bang Theory: Das geniale Spiel challenges you to fulfill the wishes of the seven main characters from the television show, and you do this through two-colored cards that allow you to play them on one side or the other. Paradox tiles can change up the rules.

172250.description: Iqishiqi (pronounced EE-chee-shee-chee) is an abstract strategy game designed by Joao Neto that is played on a hexagonal board composed of hexagonal cells. Players own designated edges of the board, and by clever placement of stones they push a neutral stone around the board. A player wins if he/she moves the neutral stone to one of his/her edges, or leaves his/her opponent unable to move. The game can be played with 2 or 3 players.
172250.name: Iqishiqi

172251.name: Blueprint for Imagination: Flawed Dupes
172251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Public records list Nevicata as a field laboratory studying climate change, like others above the Arctic Circle. But only a handful of government officials know that Nevicata Research Station is actually a top-secret facility.

After Nevicata’s radio operator sent out a distress call and rescinded it an hour later, certain listeners with ties to shadowy government agencies got wind of the situation. Calls were made, meetings held. Within 18 hours they dispatched an investigative team to Nevicata—your group!

This great new module from Matthew Cutter (Pinnacle Entertainment Group/Deadlands) is sure to be a hit whether you run this at a gaming convention or as a one-shot at your local gaming store. This module stands alone or could simply be one of the many adventures your players undertake as part of a larger campaign.

172252.name: Entropic Settings: Norlynn
172252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Norlynn is a very old village, north of the Sparkling Sea, south of the Great Riverlands, and east of the Wildlands. It is populated by around three hundred villagers, and to passersby would appear to be nothing more than a hub for the local farmers and fishermen. Those who know of the local lore, however, know that Norlynn is anything but a simple trading hub. While most of the villagers who live there are relatively average folk, Norlynn is home to the arcane order known as the Magicker's Guild, and, more importantly, the ancient building known to most simply as the House of Doors.

Norlynn is an epic fantasy location for the Entropic Gaming System. Designed as a town to be set within any setting or campaign, it’s usable at any character rank and can even provide a new home for the player characters. With a slight change of flavor, Norlynn can also be placed in any dark fantasy setting.

Norlynn includes:

A collection of NPCs.
2 new Talents.
A city with map and important places.
Adventure hooks.
… and more!




Norlynn is a complete, standalone location. It only requires the Entropic Gaming System core rulebook.

172253.name: Osprey
172253.description:
From publisher blurb:

OSPREY!

Once a test pilot looking for a rush, Osprey is now a villain-for-hire on the west coast. Equipped with an experimental wing harness and a array of deadly energy weapons, he's ready to meet your heroes head on!

172254.name: Kiqsuyapi
172254.description:
Kiqsuyapi - A game for three to eight players who are puzzle fans and fast thinkers. Here the players themselves decide about the level of difficulty, because they take turns in being the puzzle master who can ask the questions, and it is totally up to him or her what is asked: How many feathers were there altogether? How many headbands were worn? Or how many weapons were pointing to the left? Was the second Indian from the right painted with war paint? Or is there an Indian wearing a shirt, and carrying a tomahawk? The player who is able to give the first correct answer, gains a token.

The 10 playing cards in Kiqsuyapi are double-sided. They determine the level of difficulty of the game. With only 4 cards, the challenge is still moderate. With 10 cards even true champions are going to work up a sweat. And if you still consider this too easy, the expert version will be an even greater challenge for you. Here, all players have to answer and the right answer will gain you a point, as before. Wrong answers, however, will cost you points! This applies in particular to those questions that ask for two or even three aspects at once. For example, how many Indians are wearing a shirt, a headdress and are carrying a bow?

172255.name: Historia Battles Rome
172255.description:
summary written by developer for VGG

Historia-Battles is a turn-based strategy game. The game reproduces historical battles giving the possibility to enjoy them with a simple set of game rules.

The reproduced battles are:
- 1250 B.C. Troy Battle (Greeks VS Trojans)
- 508 B.C. Porsenna siege of Rome (Romans VS Etruscans)
- 480 B.C. Termopylae Battle (Greeks VS Persians)
- 390 B.C. Allia Battle (Romans VS Celtics)
- 218 B.C. Hannibal Ticinus Battle - (Romans VS Carthaginians)
- 218 B.C. Hannibal Trebia Battle - (Romans VS Carthaginians)
- 217 B.C. Hannibal Trasimene Battle - (Romans VS Carthaginians)
- 216 B.C. Hannibal Cannae Battle - (Romans VS Carthaginians)
- 202 B.C. Hannibal Zama Battle - (Romans VS Carthaginians)
- 58 B.C. Caesar Bibracte Battle (Romans VS Celtics)
- 58 B.C. Caesar Ariovisto Mulhouse Battle (Romans VS Celtics)
- 57 B.C. Caesar Sabis Battle (Romans VS Celtics)
- 52 B.C. Caesar Alesia Battle (Romans VS Celtics)
- 48 B.C. Caesar Pharsalus Battle (Romans VS Romans)
- 9 A.D. Teutoburg forest Battle (Romans VS Germans)

Rules of the game:
If all units are killed or home location conquered the player loses the game.
The unit attacked from side or back is damaged considering zero defend points.
The unit attacked can not move (it has no move points).
Unit severely wounded causes panic damage to near ones.
Unit located near home location gets +1 healing point for each turn.
Unit that kill other unit increases experience,attack and defend points, all life points are recovered.

172256.name: Unser Sandmännchen und seine Freunde
172256.description: In Unser Sandmännchen und seine Freunde, the little Sandman wants to distribute his sleep sand, but the beds of all of his friends are empty. To help the Sandman wish them a good night, players need to find those friends. If they can get the friends to their beds in time, they win the game together.

172257.description:
In the dice game ZomBee, you need to stay calm, reveal the right flowers, and (perhaps) get a lucky hand as well because if you reveal a "ZomBee" by mistake, you must lose all of your honey drops.

On your turn, you roll the dice up to three times, trying to give these cubes to your opponents. For each flower on a die, a player must reveal one tile, passing the risk of the other dice to whoever's next.
172257.name: ZomBee

172258.name: Alles Banane!
172258.description:
Fishing, trumpet playing, washing hands: all of these things can be a lot easier to explain with a banana in hand.

The gist of Alles Banane! is simple: Cards that show various activities are laid out on the table, then one player pantomimes one of these activities with the help of a yellow wooden banana. Everyone tries to guess what the active player is doing by placing their player chip on the corresponding card.

172259.name: Panik Pilze
172259.description: Players score points for having the most mushroom baskets in Panik Pilze, and to make this happen players should collect as many different types of fungi as possible. Also, you might want to lay your hands on the baskets owned by other players...

172260.name: Swipecart
172260.description:
Swipecart™ is a physics based puzzle platformer that involves racing mine carts and collecting gems. The goal is to navigate through various obstacles to reach the exit of each track. It was inspired by games such as Happy Wheels, Trials, and the mine cart sections in Donkey Kong Country.

Each track starts with swiping your fingers or mouse to accelerate your cart. After the starting line you can no longer swipe, but must use the brakes and special abilities provided to a stop at the exit.

An online server is used to track high scores, host custom user created tracks, interact with other drivers, and sync between multiple devices.

Source: The Game Website.

172261.name: The Dymrak Dread
172261.description:
Not to be confused with the TSR-published official D&D module, DDA4: The Dymrak Dread.


A fan-written adventure that takes plot elements from DDA4: The Dymrak Dread and B12: Queen's Harvest and builds upon events in DDA3: Eye of Traldar, B10: Night's Dark Terror and the Penhaligon novel trilogy to create an epic campaign. The adventure is designed for a total party level of 24, or four to six PCs of levels 4-6.

Available for download as a free PDF from the Vaults of Pandius website.

172262.name: Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhattan!
boardgameimplementation: Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden? Pocket Edition
Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur?
172262.description:
Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhatten! features gameplay similar to Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur? (which is derived from Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden), with players trying to locate places or landmarks on a world map.

To set up, players lay out game boards that feature land masses with no names on them. On a turn, players are confronted with a location, such as Timbuktu or Medina, then they all try to guess where in the world that location is. They can play it safe and choose a large block of land – scoring only a few points in the process if correct – or they can go small and pinpoint the location more precisely on one of the game boards, scoring far more points if correct, but upping their chances of scoring nothing if they miss their mark. In the end, whoever scores the most points wins.

Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhatten! is playable as a standalone game or the ninety locations included in the box can be used with the Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur? base game.

172263.description:
Posse: Wild West Justice is a wild west themed card and dice game for 2 to 4 players.

Players are lawmen tasked with capturing the outlaws terrorizing the local population. Players will recruit posse members to help bring the lowdown lawbreakers in for some wild west justice. The player that collects the most reward money wins the game.
172263.name: Posse: Wild West Justice

172264.name: Consort of the Lich Queen (Savage Worlds)
172264.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a blasted rock, floating in the farthest reaches of the Maelstrom, a lonely figure scans the horizon. Will nobody come rescue Horarion, the Lich Queen's former lover? A group of bold heros could benefit greatly by travelling to his crumbling manor house. Can you offer him eteral release from his solitary prison?

Salvation... by the sword!

While this book is written as part of the Dungeonlands setting, it would work well as a drop-in area for most any fantasy realm. Inside you'll find all you need to run this unique setting, all the background information and encounters to challenge any party of level 16-19 characters, plus new NPC's, critters, traps, and magic.

172265.name: Consort of the Lich Queen (Pathfinder)
172265.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a blasted rock, floating in the farthest reaches of the Maelstrom, a lonely figure scans the horizon. Will nobody come rescue Horarion, the Lich Queen's former lover? A group of bold heros could benefit greatly by travelling to his crumbling manor house. Can you offer him eteral release from his solitary prison?

Salvation... by the sword!

While this book is written as part of the Dungeonlands setting, it would work well as a drop-in area for most any fantasy realm. Inside you'll find all you need to run this unique setting, all the background information and encounters to challenge any party of level 16-19 characters, plus new NPC's, critters, traps, and magic.

172266.name: Palace of the Lich Queen (Pathfinder)
172266.description:
From publisher blurb:

For this Savage Realm of Suzerain enjoy an old school, killer dungeon in a fantasy setting that draws heroes from every corner of time and space!

The Lich Queen awaits in her Palace. Your heroes have survived Tomb of the Lich Queen, pushed through Machine of the Lich Queen, and now must face the apocalyptic climax of the Dungeonworlds trilogy! Reality itself twists and roils all around. Prove yourself to the universe, take the final steps!

Become a god...or a corpse!

Inside you'll find all you need to run this unique setting, all the background information and encounters needed to challenge a party of 18th- 20th level characters including the stats for a wide array of new creatures and traps!
