Wordo is a word puzzle game in which you must unscramble letters to make a word from a chosen category. There are several game modes and a two player option where you race to be the first to correctly rearrange the letters.

172367.name: Curse of the Pirate Mist
172367.description:
Your uncle writes bestselling books about high stakes adventure. He lives life like the heroes of his novels--fast paced and exciting! Since your parents are stationed overseas, you are his travel buddy. His latest research leads you both to Guyana, in hopes of chasing down a sunken ship rumored to contain a treasure worth three TRILLION dollars. The sunken treasure has captured the interest of lots of different people, the rich and powerful among them. You're intrigued by tales of a strange purple mist that overtakes those who get too close to the treasure. Will you and your uncle find fame, glory or the plot of his next novel?

From the publisher's website.

172368.name: Space Age: A Cosmic Adventure
172368.description:
Space Age is a game of cosmic adventure. Set in the retro-futuristic sci-fi world of 1976, it follows a small but determined band of intergalactic explorers who land on a seemingly uninhabited planet, Kepler-16. They soon discover there's something both strange and familiar about this alien place... And what happens next is a clash of old and new, a battle of past mistakes and future fallout.

Space Age is a graphic adventure in the vein of 1990s classics, reimagined for the new millennium and its amazing mobile devices. Told in grand cinematic style, orchestrally scored, filled with drama, humor, and nostalgia, Space Age is a golden-age science-fiction story come to immersive life.

What can you expect from Space Age? Why, no less than:
• Many hours of challenging gameplay
• Multiple characters, controlled individually and in small groups
• Tactical maneuvering and strategic planning
• Varied environments and storylines
• Puzzles, mysteries, challenges
• Dialogue, inventory, sneaking. Just like the good old days.
• Action, fun, and... romance.

Space Age is a game to fall in love with.

Source: The Game Website.

172369.name: The Trail of Lost Time
172369.description:
publisher blurb

When your famous archeologist grandfather passes away, he leaves your parents his ranch in New Mexico. But you get something he thinks is even more valuable: a map to an ancient kiva located deep on the ranch that lets you travel back in time.
Shall you touch the kokopelli image to travel to the time and lands of the Anasazi? Where will the dugout canoe take you? Do you dare access the time and place when the wooly mammoth walked the earth? And if you go to any of these places, will you be able to get back home again? For that is one thing the map tells you nothing about! Are you brave enough to walk the Trail of Lost Time?

172370.name: The Ultimate Brain Challenge
172370.description:
In the Ultimate Brain Challenge you'll need to muster all your mental dexterity to solve riddles, brainteasers, and conundrums. The game includes challenging categories such as Brain Bending Conundrums, IQ Squares, Picture Problems, and Word Mixers.

The goal is to be the first player or team to pass 10 challenges. There is a time limit of 4 minutes per card challenge, but a shorter time limit can be set for faster game play.

172371.name: The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun
172371.description:
In case you don't have enough problems in your life..here are 330 more! The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun features riddles, including logic problems, visual conundrums, lateral thinking problems, and world riddles.
Noggin Workshop's The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun can be played for any length of time. Players determine how many cards they want to play and then count out that many cards. Other cards are put back in the box for another time. One player reads out the question and then places it face up for everyone to solve. Once a player solves the problem, he/she checks the answer on the back of the card. If it's correct, that card is kept as a means for collecting points. If it's incorrect, the player is eliminated from the round, while other players continue to solve the problem. The winner with the most cards is the winner.

172373.name: Outlaws of Sherwood Forest
172373.description:
from the back of the book

Robin Hood Needs Your Help!

You are spending the summer at camp. One night you steal into the woods to find a lost arrow. Suddenly a cloud covers the moon - and you are magically transported to Sherwood Forest. You're standing face-to-face with a marksman dressed in all green. It's Robin Hood, and he needs your help! The sheriff of Nottingham has captured Maid Marian!

172374.name: Do You Know Shakespeare?
172374.description:
Increase your knowledge of Shakespeare and his literary works by playing this fun trivia game. Vote for the correct answers and win some Shillings along the way!

Place your color book pawns next to answers you believe are true. Receive a Shilling for each positive point you earn by selecting a true answer. The player with the most shillings after five rounds wins!

172375.name: Battle Roll
172375.description: Battle Roll is a 2 player dueling dice game! It's quick, addictive, portable, and loads of fun! It comes with eight beautiful precision engraved and painted dice with incredible detail. It only takes about 5-10 minutes to play, making this a great game to pull out in an airport, waiting room, or anywhere else! Because of the short game length it's also great for using in a tournament scenario with groups of people. Don't let the game length and portability fool you into thinking that there isn't a lot of depth or variety in playing Battle Roll. The outcomes are nearly endless! A game could range from a complete blow-out, to a neck-and-neck down to the last roll, sudden death victory! It all depends on how the dice fall! Battle Roll is really fun to play, but it also looks cool! The combination of custom polyhedral dice and acrylic life-stones are sure to attract attention and questions like "What are you playing?" It all fits nicely into a custom zippered pouch making it easy for Battle Rollers on the go to sneak in a quick game wherever they are.

172377.name: Windy Woody
172377.description:
Windy woody is a reaction game with a kite flying theme.

The modular board consists of 5 tiles printed on both sides.
There is one tile showing 6 kites of different colours, one tile showing boys who let the kites fly and three tiles with lines connecting the boys and the kites.

Further there are two dice (colour, task), 6 clothing cards and 21 ribbon cards to count the score.

There are 4 different levels of difficulty. For every level, the players try to be the fastest to grab the right clothing card. The way to determin the right card depends on the level.

Kites colour
Roll the colour die, follow the line form the corresponding kite and check which kind of clothing of the boy flying the kite has this colour.

Missing colour
Roll the colour die, follow the line form the corresponding kite and check which kind of clothing of the boy does not fit the colours (besides the main colour, each kite has 4 additionals clours for the ribbons and spars) of the kite.

Ribbons
Roll the colour die, follow the line form the two kites with corresponding ribbons and check which kind of clothing is identical for the two boys flying these kites.

Combination
Roll the colour die and the task die. The task die tells you according the which of the three rules to play.

The fastest player to grab the correct card scores a ribbon card.
After every round the board is modified.

The game ends as soon as all ribbon cards are distributed, the player with the most cards wins.

172379.name: BAU!
172379.description: BAU! is a wooden building game. More than that, I do not know...

172380.description:
Camel Up: Supercup includes four modules for the Camel Up base game.

Overview

Module 1, which includes the longer Race track and the new Supporting dice, makes for a longer and more exciting game, as Camels may move twice per Leg now. Also, you may spice this module up with an additional action.

Module 2 includes the Photographer and gives rewards for correctly predicting the movement of Camel stacks.

Module 3 introduces bets on positions, which makes betting more flexible.

Module 4 introduces Betting Partnerships, which allow players to cooperate more openly in games with 6 or more players.
172380.name: Camel Up: Supercup
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 44 :: Gloomhaven Review - Granite Game Summit
MOBG 34 Good cop, Bad Pingo Pingo

172381.description:
A new chapter opens in the Village chronicles! In this standalone game, each player is in charge of his very own village, controlling its entire fate. Known places and characters conjoin with new mechanisms to make up a gaming experience that feels so familiar and is yet so different from Village!

Village enthusiasts will recognize some core elements, for example, the life-time track and the village chronicle, yet the new dice mechanism gives a whole new twist and dynamic to taking actions. My Village is of similar game weight as Village.
172381.name: My Village
boardgamepodcastepisode: ba005 – Altes Dorf in neuen Schläuchen
Episode #237 - The Spiel on My Village
Episode 35 - Games with Scalable Difficulty
Episode 78- My Village and GenCon 2016 Preview
Episode 80 -- Looking for Strudel in Seattle (Part A, the First)
Garrett's Games 491 - Stronghold Game's My Village and Porta Nigra
Garrett's Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!
Heavy Cardboard Episode 35 – Food Chain Magnate
Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
RDTN Episode 97: Reviews of Tyrants of the Underdark, Simurgh, Mystic Vale, My Village, Tides of Madness and Others
Rick & Morty Star in a Board Game
The Game Pit: Episode 66 - Scythe and more….
The Long View - Quick Looks #18
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

172382.description:
Filler party card game to play 2 up 20 players. You must be the player with less tokens in order to win.

Once a card is dealt face-down to each player, the player on the right of the dealer starts playing. Each player during his/her turn may opt to take any of the following three actions:

1. Keep the dealt card and forego turn (known as stand).

2. Use the power of the card if it is allowed. Show the card and apply the power.

3. Exchange cards with the player on the right. If the player changing the card is the dealer, instead of exchanging it with the player on the right show the card, tell your intention to change it, cut the deck of cards and the card that comes up is your new card.

Once all players have gone through their turns all the cards are turn face-up. Following the playing order the card with powers meant to be use in the final round are played.

Once all the powers of the cards are enforced, the player or the players having the cards with the lowest value lose and take one token each. Death always loses if it is in play. The round ends once the tokens are hand out.
172382.name: Death Over The Kingdom

172383.name: Small Dungeons #14
172383.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a stand-alone map for your virtual tabletop game? Small Dungeons add self-contained maps to the Dungeons in Blue collection! Each Small Dungeons product contains a stand-alone, ready-to-fill dungeon map drawn in the classic-blue style. Each includes assorted tricks, traps, and features, but leaves plenty of room for the GM's additions. All Small Dungeons also include geomorph-ready versions of the GM and player maps, with the added doors, rooms, and corridors required to connect to other Dungeons in Blue tiles.

This Small Dungeon includes:

Player and GM versions of a 100x200-foot stand-alone dungeon map.
Player and GM versions of the map with geomorph-ready additions.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files (100px per five-foot square) compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

172384.name: Hearts of Chaos (13th Age)
172384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amethyst is a Role Playing Game presenting a world where a true-to-book fantasy setting is forced upon our real world. How would humanity respond? This is not some stylized view of Earth seen in books and on TV. It’s a world with all the problems, both social and political, intact.

Five hundred years after magic’s return, the remnants of our technological heritage live in the few remaining bastions—cities like ones of present day, but walled in against the encroaching magic surrounding it.

Will mankind be able to retake the planet and push the fantasy back into the realms of our imagination, able to resume our bind passion for consumerism and industrialization? Is this world better than the one mankind squandered?

Hearts of Chaos is an introductory module for Amethyst. It includes new rules and pregenerated characters for those wanting to get right into the action.

The players take the role of members of an international techan mercenary company tasked with a critical mission: Venture into a no-man’s land where few humans have been, find a rogue former colonel in lie with those born of magic, and kill him.

This adventure includes:

Five Pregenerated characters
All the basic rules from Amethyst required for play.
Monsters unique to the Amethyst setting.
13th Age-compliant rules to add technology to any game

172385.description:
The largest Roman city north of the Alps in the late Roman Empire was Augusta Treverorum. Founded in the times of Caesar Augustus and built up by generations of Roman architects, this was the Emperor's residence and a world city during this period. The remains of these most impressive structures can still be visited today. Foremost of these great achievements in the city is the massive "Porta Nigra", a large Roman city gate located in Trier, Germany that dates to the 2nd century.

The game Porta Nigra (which translates as "black gate") is set in that place and time with the players taking on the roles of Roman architects working on the city gate of Porta Nigra. Each player commands a master builder, who moves around a circular track on the game board, enabling you to buy or build only where this master builder is located. Moving the master builder to farther locations along the track is expensive, so players must plan their movements and builds carefully. The number and type of actions that may be performed on your turn comes from cards in your personal draw deck.

Buildings are erected physically at the various locations around the city using 3D building pieces.
172385.name: Porta Nigra
boardgamefamily: Stronghold Games: The Great Designer Series
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 94 - Suburbia vs. The Castles of Mad King Ludwig

172386.description:
In Mombasa, players acquire shares of chartered companies based in Mombasa, Cape Town, Saint-Louis, and Cairo and propagate trading posts of these companies throughout the African continent in order to earn the most money.

Mombasa features a unique, rotating-display hand-mechanism that drives game play. Each round players choose action cards from their hand, then reveal them simultaneously and carry out the actions. These cards are then placed in a discard pile, and the previously played cards recovered for the subsequent round.

Each company has a double-sided company track, so games will vary quite a lot based on which tracks are revealed and at which companies they are placed.
172386.name: Mombasa

172387.description:
Mighty Mice can be accommodate 2-5 players as a competitive game and 2-8 players as a co-operative game

To start, place an elephant in the center of the table and divide the mice evenly among the players. The first elephant is the base on which all mice or other elephants will be piled. Throw the dice, then add one or several mice or an elephant on top of the previous element. A steady hand, strategy and luck are definitely your best assets! Any mice that fall while you are adding to the structure become yours. Be the first player to dispose of all your mice to win!

In the co-operative game, players pick 15-24 mice dice (depends on the age of the players) and try to place all of the mice on top of the structure while the elephants try to interfere. All players win together when all of the mice are placed.
172387.name: Mighty Mice

172388.name: Gortelburg Pass
172388.description:
From publisher blurb:

This setting was used in the F series and was used as an area for multiple adventure opportunities as a separate crossing of the Border Mountains. This mountain area has several travel sections to get from the civilized area to the frontier. With a multitude of side adventures this area helps mid-level adventurers increase their experience point base. In the Filbar campaign it was commonly used to get from FT04: Havendale to FT06: Arcanum College and Cordicstown.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for mid to upper level groups of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

172389.name: I, Zombie
172389.description:
Player has control of the "main" zombie in a series of maps. The goal of each map is to zombify all humans on the map. Some are helpless citizens who run in fear when you approach, and some are army guys that will shoot back.

Controls are simple - directional movement. When you are in contact with a human you start zombifying them (brains!) Other zombies that you make can be given three commands:
follow me
attack nearest enemy
stop

If you avoid damage for a time you will regen your health. Each map has a star rating - perfect scores are based on speed and no zombies dying. Scenarios may require some forethought to maximize score.

-User Summary

172390.description:
Star Trek: Attack Wing Template sets include several high quality semi-transparent movement templates with laser-etched information on each element for use with Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Each set includes 1 range ruler, 3 turn movement templates, 4 bank movement templates, and 6 straight movement templates crafted from high quality transparent acrylic.

These official templates are legal for use at all official events.
172390.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Template Set

172392.name: Mecha: Kaiju
172392.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is 2113, and Earth is under attack.

From the ocean, a giant lizard attacks a power station, causing an environmental catastrophe.

A world government trades freedom for luxury and hides the truth about the existence of huge creatures known as kaiju.

People all around the world dream that Taoitora is coming, bringing pain and death to us all.

And somewhere, Order and Chaos continue their eternal struggle.

172393.name: Mecha: Reign of the Descended
172393.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is 2122, and Earth has been defeated.

Mecha: Reign of the Descended is a game of furious mecha combat. You struggle to survive on a war-ravaged Earth that has been enslaved by a powerful alien race. You play one of the few survivors—lucky and unlucky by turns—of the terrible events surrounding the aliens’ arrival, a two-hour period that saw 90 percent of humanity eradicated by powerful alien weapons.

Mecha: Reign of the Descended is primarily a game of survival in a world controlled by strange aliens. There are as many ways to survive as there are humans left on this world. A few find comfort working for their alien masters. Some will hunker down and try to protect their families and those closest to them. Others will find that their skills as merchants or builders are needed in this new world. Still others will take the fight to the enemy using powerful mecha. After all, the Descended are creatures of flesh and blood. Shoot them and they will die.

So, rest easy, human—hope is not lost. Before the Descended came, the limited infinity drive flung humanity to the stars. Earth’s colonies may yet be marshaling their forces for a counterattack, to free their home world and drive the weird aliens from this universe. Only time will tell. In the meantime, how you spend your time on this Earth is up to you.

172394.name: The Doomsday War
rpgseries: Daring Tales of the Space Lanes
172394.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strap in and prepare for a battle you will never forget in the latest Daring Tales of the Space Lanes!

Triple Ace Games’ line of high-octane, two-fisted tales that launch the heroes into space, where fighting evil crime lords, evading bounty hunters, and dodging asteroids (while blasting away at enemy fighters) is all in a day’s work!

This issue contains a single, stand-alone adventure.

The Doomsday War: While visiting a planet involved in a bloody interstellar war, the crew of the Blazing Star stumble upon a genocidal conspiracy to eradicate an entire species! Now the heroes must use everything at their disposal to survive and discover who (or what) is manipulating this war for its own ends. What will happen when the mysterious “Doomsday” arrives? It’s a race against time, and the future of two worlds hangs in the balance!

Epic space battles, high-speed chases, combat against impossible odds, evil plots, and a secret that will change everything, await the heroes in this adventure in a war-torn star system.

172395.name: Daring Tales of the Space Lanes Compendium Two
rpgseries: Daring Tales of the Space Lanes
172395.description:
From publisher blurb:

Its the final countdown! take a rocket into the unknown with the crew of the blazing star!

Triple Ace Games presents four epic space adventures where fighting evil crimelords, dodging bounty hunters, and evading asteroids while blasting at enemy fighters is all part of a day’s work.

CHAPTER 1: The Black Guardians: The heroes must wrest an ancient alien relic from the grasp of a dangerous crime lord, but this is only the beginning of their problems as the artifact is either the means to save a world or condemn it forever! Plus there are several others who wish to get their claws on it, as well! Freedom fighters, an old enemy and new allies await the adventurers in the dry deserts of Gator.

CHAPTER 2: The Stealer of Light: The party enters the glitzy and glamorous world of intergalactic showbiz! The life of a famous holomovie actress is in danger, and our heroes are hired to protect her during a crazy trip that will take them to the most dangerous worlds in the galaxy to shoot the most incredible movie they have ever seen! Who hates Salandra Sash so much and why? Might it be that something dark hides behind the spotlights?

CHAPTER 3: In Deadly Chant, the Xanthi (a.k.a. “spacewhales”), one of the most beautiful and strange life forms of deep space, are going mad! For no apparent reason they are attacking the domed cities and astrofarms of the Greenbelt region with ravenous fury. What has transformed these peaceful beings into merciless destroyers?

CHAPTER 4: The Doomsday War: While visiting a planet involved in a bloody interstellar war, the crew of the Blazing Star stumble upon a genocidal conspiracy to eradicate an entire species! Now the heroes must use everything at their disposal to survive and discover who (or what) is manipulating this war for its own ends. What will happen when the mysterious “Doomsday” arrives? It’s a race against time, and the future of two worlds hangs in the balance!

172396.description:
10 alternate zombies and 2 new street tiles that can be used with Escape: Zombie City.

The new zombies are: 1 x Queen, 1 x Robust, 2 x Runner, 3 x Gully, 2 x Leech and 1 x Burner, all of which have advanced properties. The new street tiles are "the scrapyard" which can have equipment from any of the three equipment piles and "the radio tower" which allows you to move some of the zombies away from the church.
172396.name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 1

172397.name: Wells of Wonder: Arcane Fonts
172397.description:
From publisher blurb:

A New Kind of Magic For Your Game!

Fantasy worlds are full of strange and mystical fonts, wells, and fountains that can imbue unknown magics upon those who drink from them…or so the tales say. In truth, these fantastical elements are rarely seen in roleplaying games, as their mystical nature is often at odds with the strict, codified rules of the game.

This book presents rules for creating your own arcane wells with wondrous properties, and ensuring that they remain balanced and usable in your game. While the focus of the book is primarily sources of water, the same rules apply equally well to other things—such as mystical fruit, or meat, to name just a couple of examples. Mix and match different benefits and limiters to create a natural source of mystic power that fits exactly what you want for your campaign!

172398.name: Szivárvány
172398.description: Rainbow colours and objects is a fun game where everyone can have fun together. The underlying theme is about recognising the pictures on the tokens, or matching the colours or creating a memory game with them. It indirectly teaches the youngest children to recognise and name colours of the rainbow while having a lot of fun. The dice with a colour on each side indicates which picture needs to be selected (or found from an overturned token). Granna have created many variations to this game.

172399.name: Nancy Drew: #30 The Shattered Medallion
172399.description:
No One is Immune to Sudden Death on this Reality TV Show! Ever since the Secret of the Scarlet Hand, the eccentric Sonny Joon always seemed a step ahead of Nancy Drew. That changes when Nancy and George travel to New Zealand and compete in the hit reality TV contest, Pacific Run. Sonny runs the show, but it’s spiraling out of control. Are the mishaps the result of cheating competitors or something beyond this world? Win big to uncover the truth!

Source: The Publisher Website.

172400.name: Nancy Drew: #31 Labyrinth of Lies
172400.description:
Thread Your Way Through a Maze of Deceit in this Epic Greek Drama!

A museum curator hires you to assist with the most anticipated event of the year, but artifacts from the exhibit are mysteriously disappearing. Are these mishaps connected to the amphitheater’s upcoming performance? Or is an unseen villain pulling strings behind the scenes? Uncover the truth and recover the missing artifacts from the Labyrinth of Lies!

Source: The Publisher Website.

172401.name: Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Winner
2013 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
172401.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Fantasia: Music Evolved", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved is a 2014 motion-controlled music rhythm game developed by Harmonix for the Xbox 360 and Xbox One with Kinect. It is the interactive successor to Walt Disney's 1940 animated film Fantasia and its 1999 sequel Fantasia 2000, both of which it is based on.

The narration directly references the "Sorcerer's Apprentice" segment from Fantasia. The sorcerer Yen Sid tasks his new apprentice, the player, with animating the worlds he has created. Players generate life in initially desolate levels by moving in rhythm with licensed popular and classical music, which unlocks gestures that change elements of the musical composition.

172402.name: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade
172402.description:
User Summary

Oliver Vartran is an 8 year-old kid on his way home from school in a world where dark fantasy and high technology exist together. Today is going to be a memorable for a lot of reasons: you're going to summon a demon, your mother is going to be murdered, and a 10-year plague, known as The Decade is about to begin.

The story then jumps to 18-year-old Oliver chatting with his gay best friend Kael, who has just found him a lead on the 10-year-old case. And it's projected that the plague will end within the week! And Oliver has just found out that he's from a long line of demon hunters ... oops. In any case, things are suddenly looking up even if you were adopted by your mother's murderer (no, this isn't a spoiler, Columbo. You have to prove it ;) ). And that's just episode 2 of a 5 episode game.

The setting and art are gorgeous. The characters are entertaining. Putting together the mysteries of the series (as there are many different pieces you need to put together) is satisfying. There are several minor side quests and at least two different endings depending on if you play as a paragon or evil incarnate.

172403.description:
Promotional card that came with the Star Realms: Legion Cardbox (large card box: 3 copies, small card box: 1 copy).

Mercenary Garrison
Unaligned Base
Outpost 5
(Gold deck construction icon)
Cost 4
No Primary Ability

Ally Abilities

Star Empire: 2 Combat
Machine Cult: Scrap a card from your hand or discard pile
Trade Federation: 3 Authority
Blob: Scrap up to two cards currently in the trade row
172403.name: Star Realms: Mercenary Garrison Promo Card

172404.description:
Description from the publisher:

Breaker Bay, the second Data Pack in the "SanSan Cycle" for Android: Netrunner, continues the cycle's guided tour of the SanSan region with sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) focusing on the University of the Californias at Breaker Bay and its students. New resources, programs, and operations reflect everything from their living conditions to their parties, as well as the knowledge they hope to obtain and the efforts the world's largest megacorps make to recruit the best and brightest of them.
172404.name: Android: Netrunner – Breaker Bay
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking News — Episode 36

172405.description:
This queenie has 2 alternate zombies, a street tile and eight new item tokens.

The two new zombies, Hammer-Zombie and Combi-Zombi, are tough and will each take multiple players to defeat (respectively 7 fists and 3 fists + 3 bats).

The new street tile is "the shack" which can be used as a safe house for one player who can not make it back to the church.

The new items give the player actions they can perform, but they can not be stored in the van:

flashlight: explore an empty location and take a new item. Discard the flashlight.
defibrilator: as long as the player is carrying the defbrillator, one calm face heals every panic face (this helps all players sharing a tile with its owner)
crossbow: counts as a fist or a bat whenever you fight a zombie
map: allows a player to move to any tile with 2 runner icons (even traveling through buildings to get there)
backpack (3x): allows the player to carry 2 more items
kevlar vest: players can use their calm faces when zombies are on the same tile as the player
172405.name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 2

172406.description:
This queenie contains 10 new task cards. Select a number of them depending on your desired difficulty and combine them with the zombie deck. When/if they come out, the task on the card must be completed before you can win.

Some of these task cards are:

Comic Collector: go to the supermarket and roll 7 fists. This mus be accomplished before players can leave the town (need to have the latest issues to read on the road)
Gang Fight: go to the gas station and bring the pain! (roll 7 bats)
Voluntary work: go to the hospital and roll 5 calm faces
172406.name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 3

172408.name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Red Band Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies
172408.description:
54 NEW cards that add a mature, comedic skew to the original movie themed card game.
Find connections between R-rated Comedies and Thrillers from the 90′s to today.
First expansion to Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies.
Professionally printed on premium playing card stock.
A new take on movie trivia games. Dominoes for movie buffs.

172409.description: The Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters Playmat can be used by one player in a game of Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters to better lay out which dice are doing what during the game.
172409.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters Playmat

172410.description:
It's Market Day, so head down to the flea market to see what hidden treasures you can find. As a buyer's agent, you are trying to find popular items, buy them cheap, and sell them for a profit!

If you are the first player to earn $45 in Flea Market, you win!


Game Summary
Players start with some money and 2d6. The goods tokens are numbered 3-18 and placed on the board. Each turn, the current player rolls 3d6 and that item goes up for auction. If it's another player's item, that player becomes the Auctioneer. Bidders (non-Auctioneers) all roll 2d6 secretly, and are allowed one reroll. Then reveal your dice: from high to low, players get the option to buy the item for the sum of their dice, paying the Auctioneer. If the token belonged to a player, that player also gets a bonus $3-7 (depending on how far in the game you are). If no one buys it, the current player gets it for free (if it's another player's item, they keep it)! The game ends as soon as someone gets $45 = winner!
172410.name: Flea Market
boardgameexpansion: Flea Market: Three for the Road
Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #18

172411.description:
Visual creativity game where players interpret inkblots to tell stories. Has many models of play a few of which we review here. More on our website.

Story Play: The Simplest RoarStack game, for casual group play or children, is Story Play wherein you relate your card to the previously played card, possibly within the optional theme of the round. In Story Play, the added sayings and card value/suits don't matter, just the inkblots and the story. This is a good mode for young children and people more interested in collaboration and storytelling than competition.

Point Play: If you want to keep score and compete with others, then you can add the dimension of point play where victory points are scored based on phrase+value on the story cards, when the conversation of the group matches the phrase. You play your victory cards at any time. Victory points can come from mundane things in the conversation from the weather, to social relations, to pop culture. Your inkblots and storytelling can help lead the conversation, but you don't score victory points from what you do/say, only from what your friends do/say. This mode encourages talking with and listening to your friends and is great for party play. Even when its not your turn to play a card, you need to pay attention and engage in dialog, maybe even trying to guide the conversation so you can score points. However, you also have to be active in the round to score so you have to keep that story going when its your turn. Victory scoring is generally simple -- you play the victory card in front of you so just count them at the end of the round.

Gestour/Best play: A mode good for larger groups or big/noisy parties is Gestour/Best mode where everyone competes to try to extend the same story. A gestour is a teller of legendary tales. In this mode the gestour starts a story and everyone picks a card from their had and tries to be the best extension of that story based on the inkblot on their card. After the cards to play are exposed, the gestour defines how they will define "best". There is an optional 30 second free-for-all period where everyone tries to convince others that theirs is the best extension. The gestour then begins calling on players who have 10 seconds to tell their card's story. The gestour picks the "best" answer and that person becomes the new gestour. Everyone else draws a replacement card. First person out of cards wins the hand.

Twisted Play: Another mode of play is Twisted play, which is good for people who play traditional card games. In Twisted play, you use just the playing card deck, and play your favorite classic card game, with a twist -- you can use the inkblots to connect cards or as wild cards. For example, in Roaring Rummy you might connect a random card into a part of a straight by telling the inkblots' secret stories and connecting misfit cards to those before and after it in sequence. In Roaring Go Fish, when you pull a card from the pool you can also match it if you can tell the story to connect it to your matching card. In Solitary Stories you can play any card anywhere, but only if you can tell its story. Here, the role of the stories is to directly help you score points in a classic game. These add RoarStack Story play to existing games, making almost any card wild by using your creativity. It adds a new twist and often a lot more laughter, to well-known games.

Ideation Play: Another mode of play is ideation -- the generation of ideas related to solving a problem. Here, the player(s) takes a problem to be solved and uses the cards to help explore the problem, the constraints, and potential solutions. RoarStack is not only a fun game; it can also be an innovation tool for improving creativity and problem-solving. Creativity in innovation and problem-solving is often about linking disparate ideas together. Given a topic people see different things in the cards, and seeing things in the cards makes connections to other ideas. In the words of the very innovative Steve Jobs: "Creativity is just connecting things."
172411.name: Roarstack

172412.name: Director's Cut: The Card Game
172412.description:
In Director's Cut: The Card Game, players are Hollywood movie producers in the early 20th century. Each player will try to put together the best movie-making teams in order to maximise the profit from each movie they make.

As movie producers, players will hire cast and crew from a central shared market, while trying to deny their opponent access to key cast and crew members. Once a player has assembled a set of cast and crew cards, they will play these cards to produce a movie from a shared set of screenplays. Each screenplay has its own set of cast requirements and awards cash and other bonuses, based on the quality of the production. The richest player at the end of the game is the winner.

Director's Cut: The Card Game is a game about set collection and resource management. It's suitable for 2 players and takes around 15 minutes to play.

172413.name: Anarchs Unbound Storyteller's Screen (V20)
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
172413.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of Anarchs Unbound art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier.

172414.name: Ball's Bluff
172414.description:
In the fall of 1861, General McClellan ordered his subordinate, Charles Pomeroy Stone, to make a demonstration on the West bank of the Potomac 35 miles from Washington DC to see if the Confederates might react. A patrol had mistakenly reported a rebel camp ripe for raiding so Stone, in turn, ordered Colonel Deven to advance on the supposed camp. Having done so, Deven found nothing of the kind. Confused, he settled his men in a defensive position and awaited new orders. Stone decided to send the remainder of the 15th Massachusetts, With Colonel Edward Baker in command, across the river so that he might conduct a reconnaissance in force around Leesburg, VA. A sharp engagement ensued with Baker calling for more reinforcements. The army strength on both sides grew to approximately 1700 men.

Colonel Baker was killed late in the afternoon during a failed attack on the rebel line. Before long, disorganized federal troops were recrossing the river. By early evening The 18th Mississippi arrived and aided in an assault that fully routed the boys in blue. Their artillery abandoned, many Union soldiers were forced down the steep slope called Ball's Bluff and into the river. Soldiers swarmed the waiting boats. Overcrowded, several boats capsized on their way back to Harrison Island. An untold number of Federals drowned in their desperate attempt to escape. By day’s end, 223 Union men were killed, 226 were wounded, and 553 were trapped and captured by the advancing rebels. In all, the rebels lost 36 KIA, 264 WIA, and 3 captured for a total of 303 – killed, wounded and captured.

Ball's Bluff is a hex-based, chit-pull system game using company sized units. It features low complexity rules and low counter density - 103 pieces. The map has been drawn by famed Civil War map creator, Rick Barber and covers the area immediately surrounding Ball's Bluff. The action represented covers only the heavy fighting which took place from the early afternoon on. Playtime, once the rules are understood will average two hours or less.

172415.name: Amerindia
172415.description:
From the back of the book:
Scenario in forma narrativa
Quattro avventure
Personaggi pronti e regole per crearne nuovi
Armi
Sistema di gioco compeleto PureCheck!2.0

translation by Google

Scenario in narrative form
four adventures
Characters and ready to create new rules
Weapons
Complete PureCheck! 2.0 Game system

172416.name: Alice in Steamland
172416.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Nella Vaporità niente è certo, tutto dipende dalla vostra capacità di percepire le cose. Lasciando Londra avete lasciato ogni sicurezza: ora tutto quello che avete sono rifiuti tecnologici e tribù barbariche, Regine pazze e conigli assassini, misteriose Profezie e velocipedi volanti. La Steamland è un luogo di infinite potenzialità, in cui i giocatori interpretano il ruolo di Londinesi perduti o di Steamlander; la Vaporità offre loro poteri grandissimi, ma dà anche dipendenza - e i personaggi dovranno percorrere la sottile linea tra uso e abuso, tra un eccesso di Realtà e uno di Vaporità.

translation by Google

In the Vapority nothing is certain, everything depends on your ability to perceive things. Leaving London you are no more safe: now all you have are technological waste and barbarian tribes, crazy Queens and murderers rabbits, mysterious prophecies and flying bicycles. The Steamland is a place of infinite possibilities, in which you will play the role of Londoners lost or Steamlander; the Vapority offers you great powers, but also gives addiction - and the characters have to walk the thin line between use and abuse, between an excess of reality and one of Vapority

172417.name: Alea:Est - Il Gioco di Ruolo di Star Trek
rpg: Alea:Est Il Gioco di Ruolo di Star Trek
172417.description:
From the website

ALEA:EST - Il gioco di ruolo di Star Trek

Il manuale base del progetto ALEA:EST, centrato attorno alle regole sui personaggi.


translation by Google

ALEA: EST - The Star Trek role-playing game
The basic manual of the project ALEA: EST, centered around the rules regaeding the characters.

172418.name: Alea:Est - Lo Schermo del GR
rpg: Alea:Est Il Gioco di Ruolo di Star Trek
172418.description:
From the website

ALEA:EST - Lo schermo del GR
ALEA:EST - La terribile trappola talariana / Per un turno di corve' - Modulo d'avventura

Il primo supplemento costituito dallo Schermo del GR e da un modulo con due avventure, errata corridge, regole opzionali aggiuntive e la Scheda Tricorder e Sensori, centrato attorno alle regole sui personaggi.


translation by Google

ALEA: EST - The screen of the GR
ALEA: EST - The terrible Talarian trap / For a chore - Adventure module

The first supplement consisting of the GR Screen and a module with two adventures, erratas, additional optional rules and the Adapter Tricorder and Sensors module, centered around the rules regarding the characters.

172419.description:
Thirteen official plexes grace the continental jewel that is India. The largest is the Bengali Mahaplex with over 274 million citizens living within its walls. And every last one of them is a fan of Fury! Developed decades ago as the very first exotic Slaughterball team, Fury is a perennial favorite not just in India, but in all 72 metroplexes. Their distinctive feline beauty and grace, coupled with the savagery of their gameplay, has earned them a place in seven of the last ten Slaughterbrawls.

Fury’s greatest strength, their savage claws that can rip other neohumans to shreds, are also their greatest weakness. These felinoids are very inept at handling the ball, and their razors are the worst shooters in the league. Fortunately, Fury razors are also the fastest, so they can usually get pretty close to the goals to take easy shots.

So, you’re not going to win on goals. You better pounce on your opponents and do some damage. Thanks to the Savagery skill, you’ll be racking up the slaughter points. Don’t save those reactive cards (Penalty, Lost Momentum, etc.). You need to be sacrificing your cards to send opponents to the Slaughter Box early. Soon enough your opponents will team up against you to eliminate your butchers and slashers. So, attack with them early and often.
172419.name: Slaughterball: Team Fury

172420.description:
Perhaps the toughest team in the league, the Gruesomes have yet to prove themselves as contenders to the Slaughterbrawl crown. Like their other teams inspired by classic literature, Chemozoic Incorporated contracted Honeydew Labs to create this team genetic template. And while the athletes certainly look the part, their traits and skills have made it difficult to rack up the victories necessary to snag the championship.

The Gruesomes as a team rely on their resilience and sheer strength to dominate opponents and survive attacks. Unfortunately, they lack the hand-eye coordination and speed to have full access to all possible Slaughterball strategies. Indeed, their shooting game is perennially inadequate. Even so, previous coaches have managed to build them into a respectable foe over the course of a season by training them with new skills and concentrating on the strategies explained below.

Coaching the Gruesomes is a challenging task, but your victories will be that much sweeter knowing it was your coaching ability, not the athleticism of your athletes, that won the day. They are slower and less accurate than other teams, and as such you cannot rely on a shooting game to win. Instead, you should doggedly attack your opponents, even taking risky chops to knock them down. You should be chopping every turn. And get everyone moved toward the center of the pit as soon as possible. Field coverage is imperative for the Gruesomes, so they are always in range to attack someone.

Your athletes’ resilience will help them stay out of the Slaughter Box, and the great Brawling values will usually result in chop success. Once you have your opponent on the ground, send your slashers and butchers over to foul them on the ground and then cancel any Penalty cards with the Scare Ref skill.

Interrupt cards are very important to your fouling strategy, so be sure to cycle through your hand quickly. If you don’t have any Interrupt cards, discard your whole hand to find some. Being able to attack prone opponents and get four extra dice is paramount. Especially when you can avoid Penalties.
172420.name: Slaughterball: Team Gruesomes

172421.description:
During the Third World War, robotic forces first assaulted islands across the world. Usually, they were able to conquer and eliminate their human foes in short order. Not so in Japan. The Japanese military and civilians fought back with intractable resolve, and saved their greatest city: Tokyo. And when the war ended with a human victory, the Japanese people rebuilt more quickly than anyone else.

With the formation of the United Globe government, and banning of advanced robots, Japan quickly retooled their industrial efforts to genetics. Today, there are hundreds of gene-tech labs in the Tokyo Metrofecture (TMF). But it was the megacorporation Honshu Tek that first engineered the Katanas team genetic template.

Tapping into their rich history, Honshu Tek created a team of samurai-themed athletes that quickly became the most popular team in the TMF. Now, with many years of strong performances, the Katanas frequently break into the playoffs and have more than one championship trophy hanging in their dojo.

Attack your opponents, repeatedly. With three skilled butchers, you should concentrate on weakening opposing teams from round one. Get your butchers and slashers into the center so they can use their mobility and power to dominate your opponents. Be sure to set up field coverage with your butchers. Their automatic carve skill can really block off entire slices of the pit. No one wants to run around those guys. After you’ve thinned out your opponents, you can have your razor snag the lonely ball and start scoring goals.
172421.name: Slaughterball: Team Katanas

172422.description:
Legion is one of the few teams in the Global Slaughterball League that is completely owned by a regional government. In this case the Metroplex Roma subsidiary SPQR. Current SPQR CEO Tiberius Antonius Caesar-Caesar has dedicated vast sums of tax revenues to develop and market Legion into a juggernaut of popularity and success. Thanks to Caesar-Caesar’s guidance over the past two decades, Legion’s legions of fans have propelled the team to be one of the most financially successful in the league.

Legion is a thoroughly disciplined team of well-armored athletes, each with their own skills to contribute to the team. They excel at cooperating with each other to overcome opponents through teamwork. The cleavers are the foundation of this team unity. They are tactical geniuses who grant all teammates a bonus to their tests, plus they can hand out additional Onslaught tokens!
It will require an experienced coach to fully understand and lead Legion to victory. You’ll have to familiarize yourself with their impressive list of skills, and stay aware of every team member at all times to make sure you utilize them to their fullest potential. Legion is one of the most complicated teams to lead to victory, so be sure you are up to the task.

Even though all Legion athletes have strong skill sets, it is the cleavers’ tactical leadership that propel them to excellence. The value of more onslaught tokens cannot be overemphasized, and you should exploit that ability every turn. Also, do not forget the Leadership bonus that each of your athletes earns from the cleavers, and that you can add up the +1 bonus to tests from each of your cleavers in the pit.
To retain the extra tactical choices that they provide, the cleavers should be protected at all times. Do not expose them to attack or you’ll lose them to the Slaughter Box, along with their bonus dice and onslaught tokens.

Also, don’t forget the other athletes on the team, who also have great skills and traits. The razor is well-armored, with just a slight reduction in Speed. The slashers can double-team opponents for vicious effect. Even the butcher is better than average with his Awesome Brute skill. And all Legion athletes can stand up adjacent teammates with Help Up. Once you learn how to synergize all these skills, you’re well on your way to invincibility!
172422.name: Slaughterball: Team Legion

172423.description:
Located deep beneath the teeming Great Lakes Metroplex, the Dungeon is where the ogres and orcs of team Carnage inflict maximum mayhem on their opponents. Both the Octagon and Hexagon of the Dungeon enjoy (suffer?) an excess of spiky bits!

The Dungeon is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules
Anyone knocked down or injured in a spike space suffers four extra knives of damage. The spaces do not block movement or the ball.
172423.name: Slaughterball: Team Carnage Arena – The Dungeon

172424.name: Slaughterball: Team Fury Arena – The Jungle
172424.description:
It’s no coincidence that the Fury slaughterdome named the Jungle is lost deep within the vast metropolis that is the Bengali Mahaplex. With over 270 million citizens, the BMP is a huge durocrete jungle, teeming with life and motion. Finding the Fury arena is a task in itself. But, once you find it, you’ll be amazed! The dome boasts ancient Indian architecture, holographic and genetically engineered flora and fauna, and flaming doom!

Fury’s owners not only genetically engineered their team, they also genetically engineered plants to impede everyone in the pit. These neovines are attracted to movement, crawling and writhing to tangle those who run by.

The Jungle is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
While in the Fury pit, the following rules apply:

Entangling vines: The first time an athlete tries to leave an entangling space during a Move action, the athlete must make an Agility test. If the athlete does not get 2 or more knives, he trips and falls down in that space. This ends his movement and no points are scored. Entangling spaces are indicated by the green leaf in the center of a space.

Fireblast: Every coach gains this ability while in the Fury pit.

At irregular intervals, the meat grinder and the launchers belch forth great gouts of flame! At any time except during an action, any coach can sacrifice an Interrupt card call forth such a conflagration from the meat grinder or any one specified launcher.

172425.description:
The Lab Arena is in a gothic slaughterdome that broods within the Wallachian Metroplex. Massive generators shoot bolts of electricity above the city as well as through the pits! These random bolts can stun even mighty butchers.

The Lab is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
All coaches gain the following ability while playing a game in the Lab:

Shock attack: At any time except during an action, any coach can sacrifice an Interrupt card to call down a bolt of electricity on an athlete in an electricity space (indicated by a faint electricity symbol).

The wildly arcing electricity in the pit will likely result in many more knockdowns. This will give the slower Gruesomes more chances to chop and foul. Teams in general will have fewer options because more of their players will be knocked down. With few “safe” spaces on the board, teams will clump up, giving the Gruesomes an easier time wading into groups of opponents.
172425.name: Slaughterball: Team Gruesomes Arena – The Lab

172426.description:
The Dojo graces the top of the Honshu Tek Arcology Prime in the Tokyo Metrofecture. The arena sports pits that are smaller than league standard, ensuring that the swift Katanas butchers have an even easier time getting to and brutalizing opponents.

The Dojo is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
There are no special rules in the Dojo. The reduced size means coaches will have to adjust both their slaughtering and shooting strategies.

Notes: Both the Dojo Octagon and Hexagon have one fewer ring of spaces, making the pits smaller. This reduction in size means that athletes are closer together and don’t have as far to run away from rampaging butchers and slashers. This should result in more brutal games.
172426.name: Slaughterball: Team Katanas Arena – The Dojo

172427.description:
Metroplex Roma boasts an exact replica of the ancient Roman Colosseum, but at twice the size! Plus, it sits atop the Caesarium Arcology, making it one of the most recognizable points of the Roman skyline.

In ancient times, gladiators fought each other and wild animals in the Colosseum. SPQR has opted to emulate this in the Legion’s home arena by unleashing random mavericks into the games. These athletes owe allegiance to no team, and earn money for each athlete that they slaughter! This results in a very chaotic game as the wild mavericks engage in all sorts of mayhem. Indeed, sometimes they even help a team that they might like. Often, Legion benefits from this maverick benevolence, making opposing teams wonder if there is some corruption going on. No proof of such has ever been presented, however.

Of course, some mavericks are more popular than others. Simba Khan elicits the most fan excitement, of course. Other butchers are also favorites, such as The Barbarian, Warren Johnston, Sandy Petersen, the Unspeakable One, and Four-Fisted Farouk. Razors are the least favorite, of course, because the fans want wild mavericks who can inflict maximum damage.

The Colosseum is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
The Legion pits include spaces called Maverick Pillars, indicated by the M. These spaces block movement and no athlete can enter them. However, random mavericks appear on them to wreak havoc with all teams.

When the goals are opened, the first maverick is revealed. Draw a random maverick card and place the matching maverick figure on a random Maverick Pillar. This is a Wild Maverick, who owes allegiance to no single team. It is his job to cause as much mayhem as possible, attacking and thwarting all teams.

To simulate this, each coach can control any wild maverick during their Onslaught phase.
172427.name: Slaughterball: Team Legion Arena – The Colosseum

172428.description:
Polished to a shiny black sheen and glowing with neon highlights and sponsors, the Core Arena in the San Angeles Metroplex is where Nemesis calls home.

The Core is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
All athletes in a Nemesis pit gain the following skills:

Strategic Enhancement: Whens standing upright on a Power Up space, take a special action to draw one card from the deck.

Power Cache (exhibition and league games only): When standing upright on a Power Up space, take a special action to knock yourself down. No points are awarded for this. You can take an Edge token of your choice from the supply. This simulates the athlete opening a small cache in the floor to grab a holotrophy that grants the coach a bonus.
172428.name: Slaughterball: Team Nemesis Arena – The Core

172429.description:
The Octagon and Hexagon of the Olympus Arena in the Elliniki Historiplex are decorated with motifs and architecture of ancient Greece. The Swords of Damocles are rarely defeated in their home pits, thanks to the extra goals.

Olympus is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special Rules:
Each Olympus pit has double the number of goals, making it easier for all teams to score points. But the razors of the Swords of Damocles are best-positioned to exploit this benefit, and games here are often very high-scoring.

All the goals start closed as normal, but since you only have four closed goal tokens, you’ll need to use some other markers (Onslaught tokens perhaps) to indicate that the extra goals are closed.
172429.name: Slaughterball: Team Swords of Damocles Arena – Olympus

172430.description:
Valhalla Arena is a huge slaughterdome that includes home pits for both of Extraterrestrial Cruise Lines’ Viking-themed teams: the Valkyries and Ragnarok. The ladies’ arena, while brighter and cleaner, is both vicious and virtuous. Each Valkyries pit contains several Choosing spaces, which can be used to heal athletes in the Slaughter Box, or kill them!

Valhalla is an arena board for Slaughterball.

Special rules:
All athletes gain the following skills while in the Valkyries pits:

Chooser of the Living: While upright on a Choosing Space, take two special actions to remove all the injury tokens (if any) from one athlete in the Slaughter Box. Then, immediately relocate that athlete to any unoccupied Re-Entry space or starting space.

Chooser of the Slain: While upright on a Choosing Space, take two special actions to kill any one athlete in the Slaughter Box. That athlete is removed from the game. Unless using the optional Lasting Injury rule in League play, the athlete is resuscitated to full health for the next game.
172430.name: Slaughterball: Team Valkyries Arena – Valhalla

172431.name: Brass Age
172431.description:
From the Publisher website

Brass Age è un gioco di ruolo ambientato nell’Inghilterra Vittoriana, con robuste influenze steampunk che si caratterizza soprattutto per il setting storico e un regolamento che garantisce velocità e suspense.

In Brass Age vi sarà possibile interpretare agenti del Club Diogene (servizi segreti anti-litteram dell’Impero Britannico) che si muoveranno tra le fumose strade di Londra per sventare i criminosi piani delle Cospirazioni che minacciano la Corona.

translation by Google

Brass Age is a role-playing game set in Victorian England, with strong steampunk influences. It is characterized mainly by the historical setting and a set of rules that ensures speed and suspense.

In Brass Age You will be one of the agents of the Diogenes Club (part of the British Empire intelligence) that will move between the smoky streets of London to foil the plans of criminal conspiracies that threaten the Crown.

172432.name: Brass Age America
172432.description:
From the Publisher website

Brass Age America è la prima espansione per il gdr Brass Age.

Un modulo geografico, come suggerisce il nome, che arricchisce il mondo di gioco
offrendo uno scorcio degli Stati Uniti di fine Ottocento.
Brass Age America aggiunge nuovi antagonisti per i personaggi ma anche
nuove Carriere, fiorite nelle metropoli come nelle città di frontiera: l’Avvocato, il Pistolero,
lo Sciamano indiano sono solo alcune delle strade che gli investigatori potranno seguire per
raggiungere il successo nelle proprie missioni e realizzare il proprio sogno americano del
self-made man.

translation by Google

Brass Age America is the first expansion for the RPG Brass Age.

A geographic module, as the name suggests, that enriches the game world
  offering a glimpse of the United States of the late nineteenth century.
Brass Age America adds new antagonists for the characters and also
  New Careers, flourished in the metropolis as in the border town: the Lawyer, the Pistolero,
  Shaman Indian are just some of the roads that investigators can follow to
  achieve success in their missions and achieve their American dream of
  self-made man.

172433.name: I Doni di Mabon
172433.description:
From the Publisher website

Ne I doni di Mabon vi troverete ad indagare sugli scioperi e le rivolte degli operai nelle fabbriche di Londra e sulla “St. James Charity for Arts Education”, un ente benefico che vuole sensibilizzare l’opinione pubblica sul tema dell’infanzia e dello sfruttamento del lavoro minorile.
Il Club Diogene teme infatti che dietro gli sfavillanti eventi mondani realizzati dalla Charity per raccogliere le donazioni di ricchi benefattori si nascondano altri intenti e finalità.
Dagli eleganti teatri londinesi alle fumose fabbriche dei quartieri operai, dalle feste in maschera dell’alta società ai pub dei Docks, i vostri straordinari gentluomini e gentildonne dovranno trovare le tracce che li condurranno a “I doni di Mabon”

translation by Google

In the gifts of Mabon you will investigate on the strikes and riots of the workers in the factories of London and on the "St. James Charity for Arts Education ", a charity that wants to raise public awareness on the issue of children and the exploitation of child labor.
  The Diogenes Club fears that behind the glittering social events carried out by the Charity to collect donations from wealthy benefactors are hiding other purposes.
  From elegant London theaters to smoky factories of working-class neighborhoods, from high society costume parties to pubs Docks, your extraordinary gentlemen and ladies will have to find the clues that will lead you to "The gifts of Mabon"

172434.name: Super Missile Attack
172434.description:
User Summary

Using enhancement boards, Doug Macrae and Kevin Curran, overlaid code onto existing Missile Command arcade machines. The result was a more luridly coloured but also a harder game: accelerated in speed and with a new laser shooting UFO. Atari sued the Macrae and Curran, claiming that they were copying code, but Macrae and Curran were successful in defending their code as a new overlay rather than a copy. Atari dropped the suit, but they also bought off the two coders and hired them to 'enhance' or design games for Atari. Their next 'enhancement' was transforming Pac Man in to Ms. Pac Man, the most popular video game of arcade era.

172435.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XIV
172435.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XIV, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 22 mythic spells, from mindblank to passwall. A mythic mind blank grants the additional protection of being able to shut one’s mind down entirely in order to avoid harmful mind-affecting effects. A mythic moment of prescience greatly expands the foresight granted by the spell, allowing you to gain a lesser benefit once per round without expending the spell, and also allows you to peer into the future. Mythic mount can not only summon more powerful mounts, like pegasi and nightmares, but can also summon enough mounts to support a small army. Most powerful of all, a mythic miracle can accomplish almost anything the caster can imagine, provided they pour enough effort and magical power into the spell. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

172436.description:
King Elvish has proclaimed his daughter, the Princess, has decided to marry. The Princess has narrowed her suitors down to the finalists present. You are all Knights in service of King Elvish. And like all Knights of the Kingdom you are madly in love with King Elvish’s daughter. After much discussion, King Elvish and his daughter have agreed that the most valiant of her chosen suitors will become heir to the throne. The first Knight to present the Princess with the 3 Gifts of Gallantry she desires will win her favour. To acquire these gifts you must complete quests and obtain Laurels of Valor. Many Quests are impossible to complete alone. So, to demonstrate you are a born leader, you must hire and lead an adventuring party chosen from the most Motley Crew of the Kingdom. But, as a Knight of the Kingdom, you have worked your whole life in service and in turn been supported by the King. You have no gold to spare. In order to secure the necessary gold to pay your crew you must moonlight on OPQ (Other Patron’s Quests). Use your gold and crew wisely to quickly complete as many quests as possible. Thereby securing your place as the true Rock Star Knight of the Kingdom and rightful heir to the throne.

In Hard Day’s Knight each player holds 3 action dice, 1 patron die, some gold coins, and a hand of Motley Crew cards. Each round begins with the available Quests of the day posted at the center of the table. A round is a single hard day in a Knight’s life attempting to complete as many Quests as possible. All players simultaneously roll their 4 dice at once. The patron die randomly determines the turn order for each round. To complete a Quest and receive the Laurels and daily income from that Quest card, players must match their action dice with the dice icons on the Quest cards. But don’t be so quick to grab those Quest cards. Each player has a chance to hire Motley crew members and disrupt the dice on the table, or possibly the turn order, as you fight it out to be the first to complete the available Quests of the day.
172436.name: Hard Day's Knight

172437.description: 18Dixie is an 18xx game set in the Southeast region of the United States. Players invest in railroad companies in an effort to have the greatest net worth at the end of the game. This is determined by adding the cash holdings of the players to the value of the stocks each owns. The money in the actual companies, though, are separate from the individual player's money. During the game, there are alternating stock rounds, where players buy and sell stock in the various railroad companies, and operating rounds, where the various companies operate. When operating, the companies lay tracks, place stations, and buy and run trains.
172437.name: 18Dixie
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 47 – Wildcatters
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50

172438.name: Rot-Eins-Rund
172438.description:
Educational game for kids to learn colors, different shapes and the numbers 1-5.
The number of shapes on the Players Card have to match to the written number on the board, to place the card in front of him.
First games should start with 4 open Cards for each kid.
There is a round course with fields showing a shape and a number.
There is 1 pig figure which is moved by the Players.
On Players turn he puches an arrow, rotating to a field showing 1 to 4 feet. The Player can choose if he moves the pig this number of feet forward or back on track.
If the Player has a card showing exact the number of this kind of shapes he can turn the Card face down.
Next Players turn.
Winner is the first player having all Cards turned face down.
In further games the number of cards can be increased to 9 and it's possible to add a Memory part. All Cards are face down first and you have to know without looking first which of your cards match the pig field. (found Cards are turned to face up)

172439.name: OneDice Quickstart
172439.description:
From publisher blurb:

OneDice is an easy, quick and flexible Role-Playing Game system. These Quickstart rules are designed to give a flavour of the game, and to get you playing right away. As well as containing most of the basic rules, this PDF contains an example of play, a short fantasy adventure and a short solo scifi adventure.

172440.name: OneDice Options #1: Mooks & Minions
172440.description:
From publisher blurb:

OneDice Options are a series of short free rules supplements that can be used to add new rules options to your OneDice games.

The these rules can be used to run encounters where the Adventurers are faced with significant numbers of nameless followers – they are not intended to be used when the Adventurers are fighting more major villians/characters.

172441.name: OneDice Options #2: Sanity & Insanity
172441.description:
From publisher blurb:

OneDice Options are a series of short free rules supplements that can be used to add new rules options to your OneDice games.

Some creatures and situations are so horrific that they can cause a character’s sanity to be eroded and his or her mind to unravel. If you want to add sanity and insanity to your OneDice game, use these rules.

172442.name: Small Dungeons #15
172442.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a stand-alone map for your virtual tabletop game? Small Dungeons add self-contained maps to the Dungeons in Blue collection! Each Small Dungeons product contains a stand-alone, ready-to-fill dungeon map drawn in the classic-blue style. Each includes assorted tricks, traps, and features, but leaves plenty of room for the GM's additions. All Small Dungeons also include geomorph-ready versions of the GM and player maps, with the added doors, rooms, and corridors required to connect to other Dungeons in Blue tiles.

This Small Dungeon includes:

Player and GM versions of a 100x200-foot stand-alone dungeon map.
Player and GM versions of the map with geomorph-ready additions.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files (100px per five-foot square) compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

172443.name: Toy Story: The adventure game
172443.description:
The adventure game based on the film
Through luck with the die and skillful challenges with Buzz and Woody you want to be the first to reach the removal van on one of the target squares.
On players turn, he rolls a die and moves along a path to reach the target the van.
There are a number of action fields of the kind:

Van moves to a further away target field
Additional turn
Take the long way.
Challenge: Duel with one other player using special Cards. Winner moves 3 fields.

172444.name: A Joy Forever
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
172444.description:
From publisher blurb:

Season 1, Episode 3: The Tyche rescues a ship full of beautiful women betrothed to inhabitants of a mining colony, but they harbor a dark secret!

A Joy Forever is a space opera adventure set in the Starship Tyche universe. It is designed to be played in one game session, as an episode of the fictional Starship Tyche television series. It can be played with those rules, or as a stand-alone using Fate Accelerated Edition.

A Joy Forever contains a complete adventure in 4 acts, statistics for two new factions (the slave-trading Rigellian space pirates, the Bascom Consolidated Mining Company), statistics for 5 new supporting characters, and rules for illicit drugs. It's not the adventure you think it is!

172445.name: Return to the Doom Tower
172445.description:
From publisher blurb:

In RETURN TO THE DOOM TOWER the characters must investigate a series of disappearances in the city of Ironhold. Their search leads them to the Doom Tower, a derelict siege tower that has laid abandoned for forty years outside the city gates. Will they survive what they find inside?

172446.name: The Perspective (Volume 2, Issue 1 - Jan 2015)
172446.description:
From publisher blurb:

News on fresh gaming topics, editorial, and the Creature Feature with 2 new creatures for Sojourner's Quest.

What is the Character Value System? Find Out!

172447.name: PRADO
172447.description:
On the steps of the Prado, four enemy tribes try to dispossess each other. The tribe chiefs have to be rescued. Otherwise the tribe is lost.
Position of the pawn gives the number of fields it can be moved. Captured pawns are out of the game.
The owner of the last tribe chief wins the game.

172450.name: Framed (2014)
videogamehonor: 2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Accessibility Nominee
2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Innovation Nominee
2014 AGD Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2014 AGD Awards Technical Excellence Nominee
2014 IndieCade Best Visual Design of the Year Winner
2015 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
172450.description:
FRAMED is a noir-puzzle game where you re-arrange panels of animated comic book to change the outcome of the story.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172451.name: Bau den Turm
172451.description:
Bau den Turm is a dexterity game. You roll a die to determine which of six wood element you have to put on a hemisphere.
When you roll the colour of an element already placed, game also passes to the next player.
The game ends when the structure collapses. The perpetrator loses the game.

172453.name: [d0x3d!] v2: a network security game
172453.description:
Like its predecessor, [d0x3d!] v2 has players working together as a skilled team of hackers, pulling off a digital heist on a secured network to find and reassemble the pieces of their digital assets and escape before being detected by the network's administrators.

Players work against time, changing network topology, and increasingly aggressive sysadmins to score their objectives and get out before they're caught, or enough of the network is taken out of service to make reassembly or escape impossible.

The v2 version of [d0x3d!] changes the modular board - instead of square, adjacent tiles with unrestricted movement, the network is now made up of (24) hex tiles with asymmetric pathing to challenge the players by forcing them to forge a path through the system, and adds two new hacker roles (the forensics ninja and the traffic spoofer) to complement the powers of the other players.

[d0x3d!] v2 is released with a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0), allowing for the free sharing and remixing of the game.

172454.name: ACHTUNG!
172454.description:
When your two choices are make laws, or go to prison, you’ll scrape the bottom of the barrel to stay free.

ACHTUNG! is an abstract strategy game about creating a multitude of pointless laws and annoying rules for everyone in the game to follow.

As players draw and play cards, the number of laws continues to build until it becomes impossible for the average player to follow them all. When a player breaks a law, and someone else notices, they get called out by having ACHTUNG! shouted at them, and they must discard from their hand of cards. Once a player loses all of their cards, they’re put in the gulag and must catch someone else breaking a law to re-enter the game. The game is over when a lone lawmaker remains.

The gameplay is separated into 5 distinct card types: Global Laws that everyone at the table must follow, Directed Laws that only effect a single player, Amendments that modify the text of cards already on the table, Filibusters that interrupt the main-game for a chance to win valuable cards, and Abolish cards that remove other cards from play.

ACHTUNG! is currently in its second edition. The second edition contains updates to the first edition rules and cards, such as allowing players to place markers on law cards to point out individual laws to play. Adjustments have also made to the Filibuster cards in the second edition to speed up gameplay.

172455.name: Brickout
172455.description:
Brickout! was an Intellivision version of the Atari arcade and video game Breakout. It was intended for the Triple Action cartridge, which was originally to have included five arcade-type games. Brickout! was shelved for fear of legal action from Atari; such fears also killed the original version of Astrosmash, which was an Asteroids-like game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172456.name: A Golden Wake
172456.description:
The Roaring Twenties: a bygone era of glitz, glamour, and promise. Nowhere is this more apparent than Coral Gables, Florida. The real estate market is booming and even an ordinary guy like Alfie Banks has a chance to strike it rich.

But with the mob on his back, the Great Depression on the horizon, and the Sunshine State’s idyllic waterfront only a hurricane away from total devastation, Alfie finds much more than he bargained for.

Based on actual events and featuring real life locations and historical figures, you must guide Alfie on his journey to reach the top of the real estate game as he deals with shady salesmen, cutthroat bootleggers, corrupt politicians, and much more, all while swept up in the events surrounding the inception of Coral Gables, The City Beautiful.

Source: The Publisher Website.

172457.name: The Maker's Eden
172457.description:
